Comedy.description: Annie (the long-suffering girlfriend of Duncan) develops an unlikely transatlantic romance with the once admired, now washed up, singer-songwriter, Tucker Crowe, who also happens to be the subject of Duncan's musical obsession.

Comedy.title: The Jungle Bunch: The Movie
Comedy.description: Raised in Africa, a penguin (John Lithgow) must return to the Antarctic to save his family and friends from the invading walruses.

Comedy.title: Kung Pow: Enter The Fist
Comedy.description: Steve Oedekerk added new footage and dialogue to a 1976 martial-arts film to form this hilarious parody about a vengeful warrior.

Comedy.title: La Boda de Mi Mejor Amigo
Comedy.description: Jules Potter, se da cuenta de que está enamorada de su mejor amigo, Michael. Aunque hay un problema: él está a punto de casarse. Cómicamente enloquecida y llena de proyectos retorcidos, Jules hará lo que sea para recuperarlo... excepto contarle la verdad.

Comedy.title: Larry Crowne
Comedy.description: A middle-aged man (Tom Hanks) loses his job, enrolls in college, and reinvents himself.

Comedy.title: The Last Word
Comedy.description: Harriet is a retired businesswoman who tries to control everything around her. When she decides to write her own obituary, a young journalist takes up the task of finding out the truth, resulting in a life-altering friendship.

Comedy.title: The Layover
Comedy.description: Best friends Kate Upton and Alexandra Daddario turn on each other while competing for a hunky fireman in this comedy.

Comedy.title: Lemon
Comedy.description: Lemon: a person or thing that proves to be defective, imperfect, or unsatisfactory. Isaac Lachmann is a lemon. His career is going nowhere. His girlfriend of ten years is leaving him. Isaac Lachmann now just watches as his life unravels.

Comedy.title: Let the Sunshine In
Comedy.description: Juliette Binoche and Gerard Depardieu star in this charming romantic comedy about a woman looking for love in all the wrong places.

Comedy.title: Letters to Juliet
Comedy.description: In modern Verona, where women seeking their Romeos leave letters to Juliet, a young writer (Amanda Seyfried) finds a life-altering 50-year-old letter.

Comedy.title: Literally, Right Before Aaron
Comedy.description: Adam (Justin Long) is definitely still in love with his ex (Cobie Smulders). So when he shows up at her wedding to prove that he's moved on, a series of funny and awkward encounters only confirms he's more in love with her than ever.

Comedy.title: The Little Death
Comedy.description: A game of sexual role-playing convinces a man that he wants to become a full-time actor, in one of several stories of suburbanites exploring erotic fetishes.

Comedy.title: Little Monsters
Comedy.description: A film dedicated to all the kindergarten teachers who motivate children to learn, instill them with confidence and stop them from being devoured by zombies.

Comedy.title: Lost in London
Comedy.description: A comedy that draws a new line between real and surreal, Woody Harrelson takes a live misadventure through London for an honest look at fame, family, and faith.

Comedy.title: Love Is All There Is
Comedy.description: The Malacicis, a hard-working Italian family recently immigrated from Florence, open a fancy restaurant in the Bronx, N.Y., drawing the ire of another clan. Mike (Joseph Bologna) and Sadie Capomezzo (Lainie Kazan), equally hard-working Sicilian caterers from the area, find they cannot stand Piero (Paul Sorvino) and Maria Malacici (Barbara Carrera). But things get complicated when the Malacicis' daughter, Gina (Angelina Jolie), and the Capomezzos' son, Rosario (Nathaniel Marston), fall in love.

Comedy.title: Lowlife
Comedy.description: The lives of a luchador, an ex-con and an addict collide when an organ harvesting scheme goes awry.

Comedy.title: Lucky
Comedy.description: Having out lived and out smoked all of his contemporaries, the fiercely independent Lucky finds himself at the precipice of life, thrust into a journey of self-exploration, leading towards that which is so often unattainable: enlightenment

Comedy.title: Luis and the Aliens
Comedy.description: 12-year-old Luis befriends a trio of awkward aliens who’ve gotten stuck on Earth after watching too much home-shopping network. With a neglectful father at home, Luis decides to escape with the aliens so he can avoid being sent away to a boarding school.

Comedy.title: Mad Money
Comedy.description: Deep inside the most secure bank in America, three desperate women from very different worlds cook up the most unlikely heist of the century: Smuggle out millions of dollars in worn-out currency headed for a Federal Reserve shredder every day.

Comedy.title: A Madea Family Funeral
Comedy.description: Tyler Perry steps into the role of the hilarious matriarch Madea for the last time!

Comedy.title: The March Sisters at Christmas
Comedy.description: A modern retelling of Louisa May Alcott's "Little Women" follows four sisters who learn their mother plans on selling their home after the holidays. In an effort to keep the family together, the sisters try to restore the house.

Comedy.title: Married by Christmas
Comedy.description: Carrie and Katie realize their family’s company will be inherited by the first sister to marry. With Katie’s Christmas Eve wedding already planned, workaholic Carrie sets out to elope before it’s too late.

Comedy.title: The Mask
Comedy.description: Jim Carrey is at his rubber-faced finest as a bank clerk who finds a mask that transforms him into a cartoon-like ladies' man.

Comedy.title: Match
Comedy.description: Patrick Stewart stars as a master dance teacher and choreographer with a lifetime of memories, who is interviewed by a young couple and unexpectedly forced to confront the painful decisions he thought he left in the past.

Comedy.title: Measure of a Man
Comedy.description: A bullied teen experiences a turning point summer in which he learns to stand up for himself.

Comedy.title: Meet Me in Montenegro
Comedy.description: In this globe-trotting, funny romance two ex-lovers meet by chance during a visit to Berlin, and their affair is rekindled in spite of the fact that they are both moving to opposite ends of the earth in forty-eight hours.

Comedy.title: Middle of Nowhere
Comedy.description: A restless troublemaking teenager falls for a tightly wound co-worker as they team up to earn big money and escape their families.

Comedy.title: Middle School: The Worst Years of My Life
Comedy.description: Rafe hatches a plan to break every rule in his school's code of conduct.

Comedy.title: A Mighty Wind
Comedy.description: The newest "mockumentary" from the inimitable Christopher Guest hilariously captures the reunion of 1960s folk musicians in New York, with a stellar ensemble cast.

Comedy.title: Military Wives
Comedy.description: With their partners away serving in combat, a group of women come together to start the first military wives choir.

Comedy.title: Miss Stevens
Comedy.description: Stuck at a crossroads in her personal life, it falls on Miss Stevens to chaperone three of her students — Billy, Margot and Sam — on a weekend trip to a drama competition.

Comedy.title: Missing Link
Comedy.description: "Missing Link" is a globe-trotting comedy-adventure about a dashing investigator of myths and monsters (Hugh Jackman) and the surprisingly silly and soulful beast he discovers (Zach Galifianakis).

Comedy.title: Mister America
Comedy.description: Mister America follows Tim Heidecker's misguided attempt to enter the world of politics. After winning a controversial court case, he launches a campaign for San Bernardino District Attorney despite a complete lack of experience.

Comedy.title: Mortdecai
Comedy.description: Depp, Paltrow, and McGregor star in this globe-trotting comedy about an unlikely team recruited to find a stolen, priceless painting.

Comedy.title: Most Likely to Murder
Comedy.description: When a former high school hero returns home to find no one cares about him anymore he becomes obsessed with solving a mysterious local death to prove he’s still cool.

Comedy.title: Mr. North
Comedy.description: In an opulent New England community, an Ivy Leaguer causes a stir with what seem to be mysterious curative abilities. Theophilus North (Anthony Edwards) takes a teaching job in Newport, R.I., where he befriends wealthy local Mr. Bosworth (Robert Mitchum). Theophilus has a biological quirk that enables him to emanate electrical charges, which appear to heal various ills. Though Persis (Anjelica Huston), Mr. Bosworth's granddaughter, has his back, his unique talent isn't without complications.

Comedy.title: Music Within
Comedy.description: A deaf Vietnam veteran becomes an advocate for the disabled.

Comedy.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
Comedy.description: A writer realizes that she is in love with her best friend and tries to stop him from marrying another woman, a guileless heiress.

Comedy.title: My Cousin Vinny
Comedy.description: Two Brooklyn college boys facing murder charges in Alabama hire New York's newest--and most inexperienced--lawyer in this riotous comedy.

Comedy.title: My Dad is Scrooge
Comedy.description: The animals of Woodsley Farm help Oliver and his little sister shock their Dad into embracing the holiday spirit while trying to save the farm.

Comedy.title: My Santa
Comedy.description: Single mother Jen dislikes the holidays, but she starts to rediscover the magic of Christmas after meeting a handsome mall Santa, Chris. Jen is unaware that Chris is actually the son of the real Santa, on a mission to find his Mrs. Claus.

Comedy.title: Naughty & Nice
Comedy.description: When a cynical Los Angeles DJ is exiled to a quaint mountain town for the holiday season, the small-town charm and holiday cheer—not to mention his pretty new co-host—begin to melt his icy demeanor.

Comedy.title: Naz & Maalik
Comedy.description: Two closeted teens from Bed-Stuy unwittingly find themselves in the crosshairs of the War on Terror when surveillance footage of their secretive behavior is wildly misinterpreted in this smart indie comedy.

Comedy.title: No Strings Attached
Comedy.description: A guy and girl try to keep their relationship strictly physical, but it's not long before they learn that they want something more.

Comedy.title: Nobody's Fool
Comedy.description: A woman is released from prison and reunites with her sister. She soon discovers that her sister is in an online relationship with a man who may not be what he seems.

Comedy.title: Non-Fiction
Comedy.description: Juliette Binoche and Guillame Canet star in this witty, seductive tale of sex, lies, and literature from acclaimed director Olivier Assayas (Personal Shopper, Carlos).

Comedy.title: Not Another Teen Movie
Comedy.description: A sendup of all the teen movies that have accumulated.

Comedy.title: The Oath
Comedy.description: A controversial White House policy turns family member against family member in a savagely funny dark comedy about surviving life and Thanksgiving in the age of political tribalism.

Comedy.title: The Oath en Espanol
Comedy.description: Una polémica ley de la Casa Blanca produce un enfrentamiento politico entre los miembros de una misma familia en una salvaje y divertida comedia de humor negro, enseñándonos cómo sobrevivir el Día de Acción de Gracias en la era del tribalismo político.

Comedy.title: Odd Thomas
Comedy.description: Small-town fry cook Odd Thomas (Anton Yelchin) is an ordinary guy with a paranormal secret: he sees dead people, everywhere.

Comedy.title: Oh Lucy!
Comedy.description: Stagnating in late middle age, a Tokyo ‘office lady’ discovers her alter ego in an English class, sending her on a comedic odyssey through desire, passion, betrayal, and ultimately the open freeways of Southern California.

Comedy.title: Once Upon a Time in Venice
Comedy.description: When Steve Ford's (Bruce Willis) beloved dog, Buddy, is stolen by local thugs, he makes a questionable alliance with their devious leader, Spyder (Jason Momoa) in order to set things straight and get Buddy back where he belongs.

Comedy.title: One for the Money
Comedy.description: Stephanie Plum, unemployed and newly divorced, lands a job at her cousin's bail-bond business, where her first assignment puts her on the trail of a wanted local cop from her romantic past.

Comedy.title: Overboard
Comedy.description: A selfish, rich playboy, Leonardo, fires a hard-working single mother, Kate, hired to clean his yacht. After getting amnesia Kate convinces him he is her husband as payback and puts him to work.

Comedy.title: The Overnight
Comedy.description: Alex (Adam Scott), Emily (Taylor Schilling) and their son RJ are new to LA. A chance meeting introduces them to the mysterious Kurt (Jason Schwartzman), Charlotte and Max. A family "playdate" becomes increasingly interesting as the night goes on.

Comedy.title: Palm Springs
Comedy.description: When carefree Nyles and reluctant maid of honor Sarah have a chance encounter at a Palm Springs wedding, things get complicated when they find themselves unable to escape the venue, themselves, or each other.

Comedy.title: Parasite
Comedy.description: Greed, class discrimination, and a mysterious interloper threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

Comedy.title: The Party's Just Beginning
Comedy.description: A surreal coming of age story told from the perspective of a young Scottish woman (Karen Gillan) trying to cope with the suicide of her best friend and struggling to confront what's truly haunting her.

Comedy.title: Passport to Paris
Comedy.description: Eager to see Paris but tired of their chaperon, identical twins (Ashley Olsen, Mary-Kate Olsen) tour France with two French teenagers.

Comedy.title: The Patsy
Comedy.description: When a star comedian dies, his comedy team, decides to train a nobody to fill the shoes of the Star in a big TV show. They decide to choose a bellboy who can't do anything right. The big TV show is getting closer, and the bellboy gets worse all the time.

Comedy.title: The Peanut Butter Falcon
Comedy.description: Shia LaBeouf, Dakota Johnson, and Zack Gottsagen star in "a modern-day Mark Twain fable that will melt your heart" (Flickering Myth).

Comedy.title: Pee-Wee's Big Adventure
Comedy.description: When Pee-wee Herman's idyllic world is destroyed by the theft of his fire-engine red bicycle, the pre-pubescent adult sets out on a manic cross-country odyssey to recover his most valued possession. Director Tim Burton makes his feature-film debut with this comic masterpiece.

Comedy.title: Permanent
Comedy.description: Set in 1982, Permanent centers around the newly relocated Dickson family. In this hilariously awkward story the Dicksons are struggling through major life changes together all the while trying desperately to emerge intact on the other side.

Comedy.title: Person to Person
Comedy.description: A record collector and his roommate, a teenager and her best friend, and a rookie reporter and her metal-head supervisor. A day in the life of an eclectic group of New Yorkers. Starring Abbi Jacobson, Michael Cera, Tavi Gevinson and more.

Comedy.title: Pieces of April
Comedy.description: A headstrong young woman (Katie Holmes) who has alienated her parents is forced to confront their troubled relationship when she learns that her mother (Patricia Clarkson) is dying of cancer.

Comedy.title: Playin' For Love
Comedy.description: Coach Banks is used to calling all the shots on and off the court. But that's about to change when he meets Talisa McCoy, a single mom, with her own ideas on a winning team.and the perfect man.

Comedy.title: Playing It Cool
Comedy.description: A young man meets and instantly falls in love with an engaged woman.

Comedy.title: Please Stand By
Comedy.description: Dakota Fanning stars as a woman who escapes a group home hoping to get her Star Trek script produced in Hollywood. On the way she must conquer a new world full of challenges. Also starring Toni Collette and Patton Oswalt.

Comedy.title: Plus One
Comedy.description: Long-time friends Alice and Ben agree to be one another’s plus ones as they power through an endless parade of insufferable weddings.

Comedy.title: Post Grad
Comedy.description: An earnest college grad's ambitious life plan takes a detour when she discovers the rocky realities of the modern job market in this film.

Comedy.title: Practical Magic
Comedy.description: Sibling witches Sandra Bullock and Nicole Kidman stir up a cauldron of trouble thanks to a family curse in this spellbinding tale.

Comedy.title: Racetime
Comedy.description: After losing a rigged sled race, Frankie challenges newcomer Zac to one last showdown. With the stakes higher than ever, Zac will stop at nothing to win the race.

Comedy.title: The Ramen Girl
Comedy.description: An American girl abandoned by her boyfriend in Tokyo finds her calling in an unlikely place: a local ramen house. Run by a tyrannical chef who doesn't speak a word of English. Abby learns how to put passion and spirit into her life as well as her cooking.

Comedy.title: Random Tropical Paradise
Comedy.description: Harry Fluder's (Bryan Greenberg) life was working out exactly as planned: great job, loyal friends, and the perfect fiancee - until he caught his perfect fiancee having sex with one of his loyal friends at their wedding. With the wedding cancelled and honeymoon already paid for, Bowie (Brooks Whelan), Harry's best man, convinces Harry to take him along on a "homie-moon." What is supposed to be a refreshing weekend of rest and relaxation turns into an all-out bonkers adventure of epic proportions of sex, drugs, and mafia intrigue. Kyle Kinane, Spencer Grammer, Joe Pantoliano, Brittany Furlan and more round out this madcap comedy's stellar cast.

Comedy.title: Rango
Comedy.description: A chameleon that aspires to be a swashbuckling hero finds himself in a Western town plagued by bandits and is forced to literally play the role in order to protect it.

Comedy.title: Rare Exports: A Christmas Tale
Comedy.description: In this darkly comic gem, it's Christmas Eve in northern Finland, and an archeological dig has just unearthed Santa Claus. But this Santa isn't one you want coming to town.

Comedy.title: Red
Comedy.description: Retired assassins are targeted for death in this comic action adventure.

Comedy.title: Results
Comedy.description: Personal trainers (Cobie Smulders and Guy Pearce) are tasked with getting a newly wealthy and highly unmotivated client (Kevin Corrigan) into shape in this smart and funny comedy about love and fitness.

Comedy.title: The Ripper
Comedy.description: When the rhythm guitarist of a band is pushed to attempt a solo, he instead starts to reveal some haunting hidden talents.

Comedy.title: The Road to El Dorado
Comedy.description: When treasure hunters, Tulio (Kevin Kline) and Miguel (Kenneth Branagh) are mistaken for gods, they face a difficult decision: keep the riches or battle the odds to save El Dorado!

Comedy.title: Robo-Dog
Comedy.description: Tom Austin creates the most incredible canine the world has ever seen! But Tom's ex-boss Mr. Willis, finds out that Robo-Dog is powered by a technologically advanced super battery, and he plots to steal it for himself.

Comedy.title: Rodeo & Juliet
Comedy.description: A city girl is forced to go to the country where she meets a special horse and a young cowboy who teaaches her to barrel race while her mother reconnects with her former fiancé.

Comedy.title: Ron White: A Little Unprofessional
Comedy.description: Ron White delivers more than an hour of all new material with his signature, irreverent storytelling style and the best comedic timing in the business.

Comedy.title: Rosy
Comedy.description: A socially awkward man kidnaps an aspiring actress so she can get to know him, but he soon gets much more than he bargained for.

Comedy.title: Rustlers' Rhapsody
Comedy.description: Rex O'Herlihan, The Singing Cowboy, finds himself in a cliché town where an evil cattle baron and some new cowboys conspire to force sheep ranchers out of their valley.

Comedy.title: Sabrina Down Under
Comedy.description: Sabrina aspires to learn about marine biology; when she discovers that the island's marine mammals are falling ill, including a handsome merman and his mermaid sister, she takes up an ecological cause on behalf of all of the inhabitants of the sea.

Comedy.title: Second Chance Christmas
Comedy.description: A woman’s husband uses her memory loss as a chance to make her fall in love with him again at Christmas.

Comedy.title: Sex, Guaranteed
Comedy.description: Kevin has sworn off sex to win back his former fiancé when he meets a beautiful escort named Zade. Over the course of a legendary party, Zade just might provide the spark that this heartbroken idealist needs to turn his life around.

Comedy.title: Sheep and Wolves
Comedy.description: In a magical land faraway lives a flock of carefree sheep. When their stress-free life is interrupted by a pack of wolves, the pack's favorite goofball, Grey, takes on the challenge of proving to everyone that he is a worthy leader.

Comedy.title: A Simple Favor
Comedy.description: "A Simple Favor," directed by Paul Feig, centers around Stephanie (Anna Kendrick), a mommy vlogger who seeks to uncover the truth behind her best friend Emily's (Blake Lively) disappearance.

Comedy.title: The Sisters Brothers
Comedy.description: Based on Patrick Dewitt’s acclaimed novel, Eli and Charlie Sisters are hired to kill a prospector who has stolen from their boss. The story, a genre-hybrid with comedic elements, takes place in Oregon in 1851.

Comedy.title: The Skeleton Twins
Comedy.description: Starring Kristen Wiig, Bill Hader, and Luke Wilson. Having both coincidentally cheated death on the same day, estranged twins reunite with the possibility of mending their relationship.

Comedy.title: Snoopy Come Home
Comedy.description: This charming Peanuts feature centers around the world's most independent pooch. Snoopy leaves Charlie Brown to visit his former owner Lila in the hospital, then returns with her to her apartment house.

Comedy.title: The Snow Queen 3: Fire and Ice
Comedy.description: After heroically defeating both the Snow Queen and the Snow King, Gerda, a selfless adventurer, is struggling with the disappearance of her parents. In order to find them, Gerda and her friends go on a dangerous mission.

Comedy.title: So This Is Christmas
Comedy.description: Eighteen-year-old Ashley's life is headed in the wrong direction. She's been hanging out with a bad crowd and seeking an escape from the drama at home.

Comedy.title: Some Kind of Hero
Comedy.description: This fast moving comedy is laced with poignancy and drama as Pryor assays one of the finest roles of his career as Eddie Keller, a man who returns home after six years as a P.O.W. to find his world changed.

Comedy.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
Comedy.description: A young tomboy, Watts (Mary Stuart Masterson), discovers that her feelings for her best friend, Keith (Eric Stoltz), run deeper than just friendship when he gets a date with Amanda (Lea Thompson), the most popular girl in school. Amanda's ex, Hardy (Craig Scheffer), who is from the rich section of town, is unable to let go of her, and plans to get back at Keith.

Comedy.title: Sordid Lives
Comedy.description: In this cult classic comedy from writer-director Del Shores, a gay West Hollywood actor returns home to his small Texas town for his grandmother’s funeral.

Comedy.title: Sorry to Bother You
Comedy.description: In an alternate present-day version of Oakland, telemarketer Cassius Green discovers a magical key to professional success, propelling him into a macabre universe.

Comedy.title: The Spy Who Dumped Me
Comedy.description: After being dumped by her boyfriend who is a spy, a woman and her friend become embroiled in a conspiracy.

Comedy.title: The Square
Comedy.description: Christian is the respected curator of a contemporary art museum, a divorced but devoted father of two who drives an electric car and supports good causes. His next show is “The Square”, an installation which invites passersby to altruism, reminding them of their role as responsible fellow human beings. But sometimes, it is difficult to live up to your own ideals: Christian’s foolish response to the theft of his phone drags him into shameful situations. Meanwhile, the museum's PR agency has created an unexpected campaign for “The Square”. The response is overblown and sends Christian, as well as the museum, into an existential crisis.

Comedy.title: Status Update
Comedy.description: A teenager discovers a magical app that makes his social media updates come true.

Comedy.title: Stella's Last Weekend
Comedy.description: Brothers Jack (Nat Wolff) and Oliver (Alex Wolff) reunite to put their beloved dog to sleep. While their zany mother plans a party to celebrate Stella’s life, things go hilariously awry when the brothers discover they love the same girl.

Comedy.title: Step Dogs
Comedy.description: Two very different dogs move into together when their owners get married. But when thieves try to break into their house, these four-legged foes must team up to defend their home.

Comedy.title: Still Smokin
Comedy.description: In this fourth Cheech and Chong adventure, the duo's view of humor, drugs, and sex are let loose in Amsterdam. Still Smokin' finds the two comedians arriving in the Netherlandish capital to go the city's first film festival.

Comedy.title: Stuck on You
Comedy.description: Conjoined twins head for Hollywood so one can take his shot at acting stardom in this amusing Farrelly Brothers comedy.

Comedy.title: Sunset Strip
Comedy.description: A comedy that takes place during 24 hours on Sunset Strip in 1972.

Comedy.title: Support the Girls
Comedy.description: Regina Hall (Girls Trip) stars as the hardworking manager of a "sports bar with curves" who runs the joint like a family, even as sketchy employees, bad customers and an even worse boss put her good nature to the test.

Comedy.title: The Sweet Life
Comedy.description: The classic story of “Boy Meets Girl” … until Girl convinces Boy to drive to San Francisco with her … so they can throw themselves off the Golden Gate Bridge.  Only they fall in love along the way.

Comedy.title: Swimming With Men
Comedy.description: It's sink or synchro for a ragtag group of middle-aged men chasing aquatic glory. The Trip series' Rob Brydon stars in this hilariously offbeat ode to following your calling.

Comedy.title: Switching Goals
Comedy.description: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen executive produce and star in the rousing comedy of two sisters who hatch the ultimate scheme to find out how their other half lives--by Switching Goals.

Comedy.title: Tales from the Golden Age
Comedy.description: With both humor and outrage, five ordinary people fight to hold onto freedom, love and laughter as their lives are turned upside down by the 1980s Romanian communist regime.

Comedy.title: Tangerine
Comedy.description: It's Christmas Eve in Tinseltown and Sin-Dee (newcomer Kitana Kiki Rodriguez) is back on the block. Upon hearing that her pimp boyfriend (James Ransone, STARLET, "Generation Kill") hasn't been faithful during the 28 days she was locked up, the working girl and her best friend, Alexandra (newcomer Mya Taylor), embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor. Their rip-roaring odyssey leads them through various subcultures of Los Angeles, including an Armenian family dealing with their own repercussions of infidelity. Director Sean Baker’s prior films (STARLET, PRINCE OF BROADWAY) brought rich texture and intimate detail to worlds seldom seen on film. TANGERINE follows suit, bursting off the screen with energy and style. A decidedly modern Christmas tale told on the streets of L.A., TANGERINE defies expectation at every turn.

Comedy.title: Teen Titans Go! Vs. Teen Titans
Comedy.description: An antagonist forces the 2003 and 2013 teams to battle to prove which team is superior.

Comedy.title: This Christmas
Comedy.description: A reunion at the holidays tests family ties.

Comedy.title: Time Freak
Comedy.description: Physics prodigy Stillman (Asa Butterfield) is destined for great things, only to be derailed when his girlfriend, Debbie (Sophie Turner) suddenly dumps him.

Comedy.title: Too Funny to Fail: The Life & Death of The Dana Carvey Show
Comedy.description: Why did "The Dana Carvey Show," with a writer’s room and cast including then unknowns Steve Carell, Stephen Colbert, Robert Smigel, and more, flop so spectacularly? "Too Funny to Fail" tells the true story of genius misfits who set out to make comedy history.

Comedy.title: Top End Wedding
Comedy.description: Lauren and Ned are engaged, they are in love, and they have just ten days to find Lauren's mother who has gone AWOL somewhere in the remote far north of Australia, reunite her parents and pull off their dream wedding.

Comedy.title: Tragedy Girls
Comedy.description: Best friends Sadie and McKayla are on a mission to boost their social media fandom as amateur crime reporters hot on the trail of a deranged local serial killer. After they manage to capture the killer and secretly hold him hostage, they realize the best way to up get scoops on future victims would be to, you know, murder people themselves. As the @TragedyGirls become an overnight sensation and panic grips their small town, can their friendship survive the strain of national stardom? Will they get caught? Will their accounts get verified?

Comedy.title: Treading Water
Comedy.description: A charming coming-of-age love story about a sensitive boy (Douglas Smith) whose rare disorder and eccentric family render him an outsider - until Laura (Zoë Kravitz) swims her way into his life.

Comedy.title: The Trip
Comedy.description: THE TRIP is an improvised tour of the North of England reuniting comedy favorites Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon. In the style of Curb your Enthusiasm, the story is fictional but based around their real personas. When Steve is commissioned by the food supplement of a Sunday newspaper to review half a dozen restaurants, he decides to mix work with pleasure and plans a trip around the North of England with his food loving American girlfriend. But when his girlfriend decides to leave him and return to the States, Steve is faced with a week of meals for one, not quite the trip he had in mind. Reluctantly, he calls Rob, the only person he can think of who will be available. Rob, never one to turn down a free lunch (let alone six) agrees, and together they set off for a culinary adventure.

Comedy.title: The Trip to Greece
Comedy.description: Funnymen Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon travel to restaurants, hotels and ancient landmarks in Greece.

Comedy.title: The Trip to Italy
Comedy.description: Michael Winterbottom's film The Trip took comedians Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon—or fictionalized versions thereof—on a restaurant tour around northern England. In this witty and incisive follow-up, the pair reunite for a new culinary road trip, a grand tour of Italy while indulging in some sparkling banter and impersonation-offs. The characters enjoy mouthwatering meals in gorgeous settings from Liguria to Capri while riffing on subjects as varied as Tom Hardy's vocal register as Bane, the artistic merits of 'Jagged Little Pill,' and, of course, the virtue of sequels. Effortlessly melding the brilliant comic interplay between Coogan and Brydon into quieter moments of self-reflection, Trip to Italy serves up insightful ruminations on the nuances of friendship and the juggling of family and career. The result is a biting portrait of modern-day masculinity.

Comedy.title: The Trip to Spain
Comedy.description: Steve and Rob sample the restaurants and hotels of the Spanish coastline, trading jokes and impressions over their lunches.

Comedy.title: Trolls World Tour
Comedy.description: When the kingdom is invaded by Rock Trolls, Queen Poppy (Anna Kendrick) and Branch (Justin Timberlake) embark on an epic quest to find the harmony that will save them all.

Comedy.title: The Truth About Cats & Dogs
Comedy.description: A successful vet & radio show host - suffering from low self-esteem - asks her gorgeous model friend to impersonate her when a handsome man wants to date her. With Ben Chaplin, Jamie Foxx.

Comedy.title: The Truth About Christmas
Comedy.description: An encounter with a Santa results in a drastic change.

Comedy.title: The Turkey Bowl
Comedy.description: A man is pulled back to his rural hometown by his high school buddies on Thanksgiving to finish the Turkey Bowl - a football game against their cross town rivals that was snowed out 15 years prior.

Comedy.title: Tyrel
Comedy.description: Tyler (Jason Mitchell) is the lone black man on a weekend getaway with hard partying white strangers. As the testosterone and alcohol get out of hand, Tyler's trip begins to feel like a nightmare.

Comedy.title: UglyDolls
Comedy.description: An animated adventure in which the free-spirited UglyDolls confront what it means to be different, struggle with a desire to be loved, and ultimately discover who you truly are is what matters most.

Comedy.title: Under the Tree
Comedy.description: After moving back home, a man gets sucked into a dispute between his parents and their neighbors over an old and beautiful tree. What starts as a typical spat unexpectedly and violently reaches a boiling point, soon spiraling out of control.

Comedy.title: Undrafted
Comedy.description: When twelve ragtag teammates set out to play what should be a meaningless summer intramural baseball game, it ends up becoming the most important game of their lives.

Comedy.title: The Unicorn
Comedy.description: An engaged couple, Caleb (Nick Rutherford) and Malory (Lauren Lapkus), set out on a wild night after discovering the secret to a happy marriage, but this experience inadvertently tests their relationship in ways they never imagined.

Comedy.title: Up in the Air
Comedy.description: Ryan Bingham  is living the high life. Flying all over the world on business, he never stops moving...until he meets Alex, a fellow passenger and learns that life isn't about the journey, but the connections made along the way.

Comedy.title: A Very Brady Christmas
Comedy.description: Deck the halls with love and laughter as the Brady Bunch comes home for Christmas! Mike, Carol and the whole gang are back, in a warm and wonderful two hour special featuring all of the characters from the popular series - plus their new families.

Comedy.title: VHYES
Comedy.description: 12-year-old Ralph mistakenly records home videos and his favorite late night shows over his parents’ wedding tape. A comedic wave of home shopping clips, censored pornography, & true-crime tales that threaten to rewind reality.

Comedy.title: Vice
Comedy.description: The untold true story of Vice President Dick Cheney, a Washington insider who changed the course of history.

Comedy.title: Villains
Comedy.description: A pair of amateur criminals break into a suburban home and stumble upon a dark secret that two sadistic homeowners will do anything to keep from getting out.

Comedy.title: Waiting for Guffman
Comedy.description: Would-be Broadway director Corky St. Clair writes, directs, choreographs and costumes a local show celebrating Blaine, Missouri's 150th anniversary in this hilarious comic spoof.

Comedy.title: We Have a Pope
Comedy.description: A comic and fictional exploration of the emotional struggles of a newly-elected pope coming to terms with the demands of his position.

Comedy.title: The Weather Man
Comedy.description: Popular Chicago weatherman Dave Spritz  has a shot at the big time when a national morning television show calls him for an audition. Professionally, Dave is on top of the world, but his personal life is in complete disarray.

Comedy.title: The Wedding Planner
Comedy.description: A romantic comedy about love, destiny and other events you just can't plan for. Mary Fiore (Lopez) is a wedding planner whose singular dedication to her work has kept her from finding the man of her dreams.

Comedy.title: The Weekend
Comedy.description: An acerbic comedian (Sasheer Zamata) becomes romantically entangled with her ex (Tone Bell), his new girlfriend (DeWandaWise), and another guest (Y'LanNoel) during a weekend getaway, in the newest feature from Stella Meghie (Jean of the Joneses).

Comedy.title: Were The World Mine
Comedy.description: If you had a love-potion, who would you make fall madly in love with you? Timothy, prone to escaping his dismal high school reality through dazzling musical daydreams, gets to answer that question in a very real way.

Comedy.title: What Men Want
Comedy.description: A woman is boxed out by the male sports agents in her profession, but gains an unexpected edge over them when she develops the ability to hear their thoughts.

Comedy.title: When a Man Comes Home
Comedy.description: A sexy comedy about a small town with some big drama.

Comedy.title: Where'd You Go, Bernadette
Comedy.description: Cate Blanchett stars as Bernadette, a loving mother and wife who embarks on journey to rediscover herself.

Comedy.title: The Whistlers
Comedy.description: A Romanian police officer, determined to free from prison a crooked businessman who knows where a mobster's money is hidden, must learn the difficult ancestral language used on the island of Gomera.

Comedy.title: Wild Nights With Emily
Comedy.description: Molly Shannon stars as Emily Dickinson in Wild Nights with Emily, a humorous and bold take on the iconic American poet.

Comedy.title: Wild Rose
Comedy.description: WILD ROSE tells the complicated story of musician Rose-Lynn, a woman from Scotland who is on a quest to become a country music star, while also grappling with the responsibilities of being recently released from prison and a young mother.

Comedy.title: WolfCop
Comedy.description: One evening during the late shift, Lou investigates a mysterious disturbance at the edge of town and wakes up with a pentagram carved in his chest, heightened senses and body hair that’s growing at an alarming rate.

Comedy.title: Woman at War
Comedy.description: Halla declares a one-woman-war on the local aluminum industry. But as she prepares to abandon her role as environmental activist to become a mother, she decides to plot one final attack to deal the aluminum industry a crippling blow.

Comedy.title: Wonder Park
Comedy.description: Wonder Park tells the story of a magnificent amusement park where the imagination of a wildly creative girl named June comes alive.

Comedy.title: The Year of Spectacular Men
Comedy.description: Izzy has a bad case of pre-real-world millennial-itis. She falls in and out of some not so romantic romances, and figures out that when it totally feels like the end of your story, it’s often just the beginning.

Comedy.title: You Don't Mess With the Zohan
Comedy.description: An Israeli Mossad agent leaves the army and moves to New York to try to work with the CEO of John Paul Mitchell, John Paul DeJoria, as a hairdresser. When his offer is rejected, he vows to make DeJoria's life unbearable.

Comedy.title: You Laugh But It's True
Comedy.description: In the world of stand-up comedy in South Africa, Trevor Noah uses his experiences during Apartheid to prepare for the biggest show of his life.

Comedy.title: Zapped
Comedy.description: Zoey discovers a smartphone app that magically controls boys.

Crime.title: 52 Pick-Up
Crime.description: A wealthy industrialist's career and domestic life are threatened when he is caught in a compromising position with a young girl and is subsequently blackmailed.

Crime.title: The Bank Job
Crime.description: A 1971 bank heist yields not just a fortune but a wealth of state secrets.

Crime.title: Brick Mansions
Crime.description: In a dystopian Detroit, An undercover cop, with the help of an ex-con, navigates a dangerous neighborhood that's surrounded by a containment wall in order to bring down a crime lord and his plot to devastate the entire city.

Crime.title: Cartels
Crime.description: An elite team of DEA agents and a dangerous drug lord await extraction and find themselves trapped in an ambush!

Crime.title: The Client
Crime.description: A lawyer protects a boy who stands amidst a firestorm involving mobsters and the law in this adaptation of John Grisham's novel.

Crime.title: Cold War
Crime.description: The Hong Kong police department has long been untouchable...until hijackers kidnap five highly trained officers and expose a mole within the task force.

Crime.title: The Con Is On
Crime.description: This stylish, star-studded caper comedy stars Uma Thurman and Tim Roth as a con-artist couple cooking up a jewel-theft scam in LA to pay off a sexy, deadly British gangster.

Crime.title: Cortex
Crime.description: A retired lawman (André Dussollier) who has Alzheimer's disease suspects that a serial killer is loose in his nursing home.

Crime.title: Criminal Law
Crime.description: Attorney Ben Chase successfully defends accused killer Martin Thiel.  It is only after proving his client's innocence by discrediting eyewitness,  that Chase discovers Thiel is guilty--and intends to kill again.

Crime.title: Desperate Hours
Crime.description: An escaped convict and his two partners invade the home of an estranged Utah couple.

Crime.title: Destroyer
Crime.description: Destroyer is a gritty, riveting and complex crime thriller starring Oscar-winner Nicole Kidman in a virtuoso performance as a hardened detective worn down by the rigors of her job and the aftermath of an undercover FBI sting gone horribly wrong.

Crime.title: Detroit
Crime.description: From the Academy Award winning director of THE HURT LOCKER and ZERO DARK THIRTY, DETROIT tells the gripping story of one of the most terrifying moments during the civil unrest that rocked Detroit in the summer of '67.

Crime.title: Deuces Wild
Crime.description: In the summer of 1958 Brooklyn was in a state of unrest. Rumbles escalated into gunfights and honor quickly became a thing of the past. A new breed of wiseguys threatened to take control of Brooklyn's streets, but one gang would not back down: the Deuces.

Crime.title: Dogman
Crime.description: Marcello is coerced into the petty criminal schemes of the local bully. When Simoncino’s abuse finally brings Marcello to a breaking point, he decides to stand up for his own dignity through an act of vengeance, with unintended consequences.

Crime.title: Escape from Alcatraz
Crime.description: Based on true events! A hardened convict engineers an elaborate plan to escape infamous Alcatraz Prison - a feat nobody had successfully accomplished before. Directed by Don Siegel (Dirty Harry).

Crime.title: The Guilty
Crime.description: When a 911 dispatcher and former cop answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman, he has to find a way to save her using just his phone and his wits in this pulse pounding, award-winning crime thriller. Danish, subtitled in English.

Crime.title: Hounds of Love
Crime.description: When Vicki Maloney is randomly abducted from a suburban street by a disturbed couple, she realizes she must drive a wedge between them if she is to survive.

Crime.title: The House That Jack Built
Crime.description: Matt Dillon is a serial killer for whom murder is a work of art in the audacious, masterfully provocative new film from renegade visionary Lars von Trier.

Crime.title: If Beale Street Could Talk
Crime.description: Based on the novel by James Baldwin, "If Beale Street Could Talk" is a soulful drama about a young couple fighting for justice in the name of love and the promise of the American dream.

Crime.title: In the Fade
Crime.description: Katja’s husband and son are killed in a bomb attack. The mind numbing reasons behind the senseless act and eventual trial against the two suspects, a couple from the neo-Nazi scene, push Katja to the edge with no alternative but justice.

Crime.title: Inside Out
Crime.description: After being released from prison after serving 13 years, AJ's dreams of living a crime-free life soon come to an end when he discovers his childhood friend, Jack, has been marked for death.

Crime.title: Intrigo: Death of an Author
Crime.description: In this tense, riveting thriller starring Academy Award winner Ben Kingsley (GANDHI), an author plots the murder of his wife—but her body is never found, and he’s convinced that she’s still alive.

Crime.title: Intrigo: Samaria
Crime.description: Years after the brutal murder of her college friend, a woman decides to make a documentary about the case and enlists the help of her former professor.

Crime.title: Killer Joe
Crime.description: When a debt puts a young man's life in danger, he turns to putting a hit out on his evil mother in order to collect the insurance.

Crime.title: Killers Anonymous
Crime.description: Tensions mount at KILLERS ANONYMOUS, a support group for killers, as the members of the group try to unravel a mystery: Which one of them is responsible for the assassination attempt on a U.S. senator that has the police in the city on high alert?

Crime.title: A Kind of Murder
Crime.description: Patrick Wilson and Jessica Biel star in this Hitchcockian noir based on a novel by Patricia Highsmith (The Talented Mr. Ripley, Carol).

Crime.title: The Landing
Crime.description: A riveting investigation into the end of Apollo 18, the last US mission to the moon. Interviews conducted for the flight's 25th anniversary reveal new mysteries around the controversial tragedy that almost destroyed an American institution.

Crime.title: The Limehouse Golem
Crime.description: With the Limehouse Golem serial killer on the loose and taunting the police with messages written in blood, Inspector Kildare (Bill Nighy) must rely on help from a troubled witness (Olivia Cooke) to bring the killer to justice.

Crime.title: The Man From London
Crime.description: A switchman at a seaside railway witnesses a murder but does not report it after he finds a suitcase full of money at the scene of the crime.

Crime.title: Maze
Crime.description: Based on the incredible true story of the 1983 mass break-out of 38 IRA prisoners from the HMP Maze high security prison, one prisoner engineers the largest European prison escape since World War II.

Crime.title: The Mechanic
Crime.description: In a role that powered him to stardom, Charles Bronson is an underworld executioner who turns murder into an art form in this ultimate crime chiller that co-stars Jan-Michael Vincent and Jill Ireland.

Crime.title: Mississippi Burning
Crime.description: When three civil rights workers disappear in 1964 Mississippi, two FBI agents with wildly divergent styles resort to increasingly violent tactics to apprehend the culprit Ku Klux Klan. Crucial to the case is the testimony of a beautician.

Crime.title: Monsters and Men
Crime.description: A bystander films the death of a black man at the hands of police, which sparks rising tensions in a New York neighborhood as some are moved to take a stand.

Crime.title: Mother
Crime.description: A woman embarks on an obsessive quest to clear her son's name of murder.

Crime.title: One for the Money
Crime.description: Stephanie Plum, unemployed and newly divorced, lands a job at her cousin's bail-bond business, where her first assignment puts her on the trail of a wanted local cop from her romantic past.

Crime.title: Out of Blue
Crime.description: Patricia Clarkson is a New Orleans detective whose hunt for a killer draws her into a mystery of cosmic proportions in this tantalizing noir thriller.

Crime.title: Polisse
Crime.description: A gripping police drama based on true accounts from the Parisian child protection unit.

Crime.title: Racer and the Jailbird
Crime.description: Loyalties are tested when a gangster and race car driver fall in love.

Crime.title: Reasonable Doubt
Crime.description: A District Attorney has his life turned upside down when he's involved in a hit and run and another man is arrested for his crime.

Crime.title: Room of Death
Crime.description: In this creepy murder mystery, victims of a serial killer are being mangled to look like dolls; a rookie female detective tries desperately to stop the killing.

Crime.title: Running with the Devil
Crime.description: When a cocaine shipment is compromised, a drug cartel’s CEO, known as The Boss orders his most trusted henchman, The Cook, and his partner, another master drug trafficker known as The Man, on a dangerous journey to audit the company’s supply chain.

Crime.title: Savage Youth
Crime.description: The lives of six troubled teens in a racially-divided town take a violent turn when drugs and broken hearts intermix. Based on true events.

Crime.title: Sea of Shadows
Crime.description: Sea of Shadows uncovers a black market that threatens the extinction of the vaquita.

Crime.title: Shoplifters
Crime.description: On the margins of Tokyo, a dysfunctional band of outsiders is united by fierce loyalty and a penchant for petty theft. When the young son is arrested, secrets are exposed that upend their tenuous, below-the-radar existence.

Crime.title: The Sisters Brothers
Crime.description: Based on Patrick Dewitt’s acclaimed novel, Eli and Charlie Sisters are hired to kill a prospector who has stolen from their boss. The story, a genre-hybrid with comedic elements, takes place in Oregon in 1851.

Crime.title: Slow Burn
Crime.description: A district attorney who's running for mayor suddenly finds himself embroiled in a case of murder and financial corruption in this edgy thriller starring Ray Liotta, LL Cool J, Jolene Blalock, Mekhi Phifer, Taye Diggs and Chewitel Ejiofor.

Crime.title: The Tall Man
Crime.description: Starring Jessica Biel. In an isolated town, children are vanishing without a trace and the locals believe a mysterious entity known as "The Tall Man" is responsible. Town nurse Julia is a skeptic, until her own child disappears.

Crime.title: Terminal
Crime.description: Margot Robbie, Simon Pegg and Mike Myers star in this twisted tale of two assassins carrying out a sinister mission, a teacher battling a fatal illness, an enigmatic janitor and a waitress leading a dangerous double life.

Crime.title: This World, Then the Fireworks
Crime.description: Fraternal twin grifters Marty and Carol Lakewood reunite in their mother's California home after suffering personal and professional failures.

Crime.title: Vault
Crime.description: VAULT tells the true story of a group of small time criminals who attempt to pull off the biggest heist in American history: stealing over $30 million from the Mafia in the smallest state in the union, Rhode Island.

Crime.title: Walking Tall
Crime.description: Based on true events in the life of Tennessee sheriff Buford Pusser, who "removes" corruption in his county with a four-foot-long wooden club.

Crime.title: Wanted
Crime.description: A frustrated office worker finds his calling as a member in a secret society of assassins in this eye-popping action-thriller.

Crime.title: Wild Card
Crime.description: Nick Wild is a Las Vegas bodyguard with lethal professional skills and a personal gambling problem. When a friend is beaten by a sadistic thug, Nick strikes back, only to find out the thug is the son of a powerful mob boss

Documentaries.title: 78/52: Hitchcock's Shower Scene
Documentaries.description: Just when you thought it was safe to go back in the shower... Discover how Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho changed film history forever with one shocking scene.

Documentaries.title: Above and Beyond
Documentaries.description: In 1948, a group of Jewish American pilots flew for Israel in its War of Independence. The first feature-length doc about the foreign airmen in the ’48 War, ABOVE AND BEYOND weaves interviews and footage to present a fascinating, little-known tale.

Documentaries.title: Above and Beyond: NASA's Journey to Tomorrow
Documentaries.description: Directed, produced, and narrated by Academy Award®-nominated and Emmy®-winning Rory Kennedy, the film examines the ways NASA has changed not only our vision of the universe, but also our planet, and ourselves.

Documentaries.title: Above Majestic
Documentaries.description: A provocative look at what it takes to hide a multi-trillion dollar Secret Space Program from the public and the implications this has for humanity. Featuring David Wilcock, Corey Goode, John Desouza, Niara Isley, Jordan Sather, and more.

Documentaries.title: Active Measures
Documentaries.description: ACTIVE MEASURES chronicles the most successful espionage operation in Russian history, the US presidential election of 2016. Filmmakers expose an insidious plot devised by Putin to disrupt and control world events.

Documentaries.title: After Parkland
Documentaries.description: In the days after the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in 2018 that killed 17 people and launched a nationwide student movement. filmmakers embedded with students and families whose lives were forever transformed.

Documentaries.title: Alive
Documentaries.description: Alive follows the journeys of a number of veterans who turn to adaptive athletics to help them heal both physically and emotionally from their battle wounds.

Documentaries.title: Alive and Kicking
Documentaries.description: After getting involved in swing dancing, some people are inspired to look inside themselves and make changes in their lives.

Documentaries.title: All the Wild Horses
Documentaries.description: All the Wild Horses follows endurance horse riders from the United States, Canada, South Africa, Ireland, the United Kingdom and the Netherlands as they compete in the wild and therefore untamed Mongol Derby horse race in Mongolia.

Documentaries.title: Amazing Grace
Documentaries.description: A documentary presenting the live recording of Aretha Franklin's album Amazing Grace at The New Temple Missionary Baptist Church in Watts, Los Angeles in January 1972.

Documentaries.title: The Amazing Johnathan Documentary
Documentaries.description: What begins as a seemingly ordinary profile of a dying magician becomes an unexpected and increasingly bizarre journey as filmmaker Ben Berman struggles to separate truth from illusion.

Documentaries.title: Amy Winehouse: A Final Goodbye
Documentaries.description: A Final Goodbye is an intimate look into the life and times of Amy Winehouse from her rise to pop superstardom through to the inner demons that inspired her work and eventually caused her untimely death.

Documentaries.title: And We Go Green
Documentaries.description: Professional drivers on the international Formula E circuit - like Formula One, but with eco-friendly electric cars - race for victory across 10 cities in this white-knuckle documentary.

Documentaries.title: Andy Irons: Kissed by God
Documentaries.description: Three-time world champion surfer Andy Irons quietly battled bipolar disorder and opioid addiction throughout his life - demons that millions of others combat daily. His previously untold story tears down myths associated with the diseases.

Documentaries.title: Apollo 11
Documentaries.description: Crafted from a newly-discovered trove of 70mm footage, and more than 11,000 hours of uncatalogued audio recordings, Apollo 11 goes straight to the heart of NASA's most celebrated mission.

Documentaries.title: Ask Dr. Ruth
Documentaries.description: Ask Dr. Ruth chronicles the incredible life of Dr. Ruth Westheimer, a Holocaust survivor who became America's most famous sex therapist. As her 90th birthday approaches, she revisits her painful past and career at the forefront of the sexual revolution.

Documentaries.title: Autonomy
Documentaries.description: Acclaimed author, Malcolm Gladwell, leads this feature documentary about the emerging technology of self-driving vehicles and the big questions they raise: what is control and who do we become as we relinquish it to machines?

Documentaries.title: B.B. King: On the Road
Documentaries.description: B.B. King: On The Road takes viewers through the days spent travelling and the nights spent performing in between life’s milestones featuring new and exclusive contributions from B.B. King as he began to wind down touring.

Documentaries.title: Bad Reputation
Documentaries.description: The life and career of Joan Jett from her early years ripping it up onstage as the founder and backbone of hard-rock legends The Runaways, to her solo career and the enduring presence as a rock 'n' roll pioneer and mentor.

Documentaries.title: Ballet Now
Documentaries.description: Featuring New York City Ballet’s Prima Ballerina Tiler Peck - the first ever woman to be asked to curate The Music Center’s famed BalletNOW program - and a diverse cast of world-class dancers from around the globe, the film follows Tiler as she tries to execute her groundbreaking vision of mashing together the worlds of tap, hip-hop, ballet and even clown artistry. With less than a week to pull it all off, Tiler faces the mounting pressures of not only dancing in multiple pieces but also producing and directing this high profile event. The success of the performances rests squarely on her shoulders. Will she pull it off?

Documentaries.title: Batman & Bill
Documentaries.description: For years, Bob Kane has been credited as Batman's creator. As time passed, rumors swirled that the Caped Crusader had another father.  Who was this man? Batman & Bill tells the story of the uncredited creator of Batman, and a crusade to bring him justice.

Documentaries.title: The Beatles: Eight Days a Week - The Touring Years
Documentaries.description: In 1962 four young men John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr came together to form the 20th century musical phenomenon known as, "The Beatles."  The band stormed Europe in 1963, and, in 1964, they conquered America.

Documentaries.title: The Beatles: Made on Merseyside
Documentaries.description: The Beatles: Made on Merseyside recounts how American rock ‘n’ roll and rhythm and blues dragged post-war Liverpool into one of the most vibrant music cities ever with the Mersey Sound.

Documentaries.title: A Beautiful Planet
Documentaries.description: A Beautiful Planet is a breathtaking portrait of Earth from space. Made in cooperation with NASA, the film features stunning footage of our magnificent blue planet -- and the effects humanity has had on it over time.

Documentaries.title: Becoming Bond
Documentaries.description: A Hulu Original Documentary chronicling the bizarre true story of George Lazenby, an Australian car mechanic, who managed to land the role of James Bond despite never acting a day in his life.

Documentaries.title: Best of Enemies
Documentaries.description: In 1968, ideological opposites William F. Buckley Jr. and Gore Vidal hold a series of riveting, nationally televised debates that usher in a new era of public discourse and pundit TV.

Documentaries.title: Big Men
Documentaries.description: Executive produced by Brad Pitt, Big Men is a real-life Treasure of the Sierra Madre about ambitious people who uncover oil in one of the poorest places on earth. An international  suspense story with extraordinary access.

Documentaries.title: Bigfoot Girl
Documentaries.description: After encountering Bigfoot as a child, Kiana instantly felt a connection with the creature. With the help of other experiencers, she sets out to secret locations with recent sightings to find closure to the biggest question of her life.

Documentaries.title: The Biggest Little Farm
Documentaries.description: The Biggest Little Farm follows two dreamers and their beloved dog when they make a choice that takes them from their tiny L.A. apartment and into the countryside to build one of the most diverse farms of its kind in complete coexistence with nature.

Documentaries.title: Blackfish
Documentaries.description: Killer whales are beloved, majestic, friendly giants, yet infamous for their capacity to kill viciously. Blackfish unravels the complexities of this dichotomy, employing the story of the notorious performing whale Tilikum.

Documentaries.title: Boom for Real: The Late Teenage Years of Jean-Michel Basquiat
Documentaries.description: Follow Basquiat's life pre-fame and how New York City, the times, the people and the movements surrounding him formed the artist he became.

Documentaries.title: The Brink
Documentaries.description: The Brink follows Steve Bannon leading up to the 2018 mid-term elections in the United States. A keen manipulator of the press Bannon continues to draw headlines and protests wherever he goes, feeding the powerful myth on which his survival relies.

Documentaries.title: Burn
Documentaries.description: An action-packed documentary about Detroit told through the eyes of firefighters charged with the thankless task of saving a city that many have written off as dead.

Documentaries.title: The Cage Fighter
Documentaries.description: A mixed martial arts competitor risks everything—his family, his marriage, even his life—to keep fighting in this riveting, true-life tale of resilience.

Documentaries.title: A Cam Life
Documentaries.description: An undaunted look into the cam business from performers and clients to website and studio owners.

Documentaries.title: Cannabis Evolution
Documentaries.description: Science has confirmed marijuana has the potential to treat physical and mental conditions, from cancer to PTSD. But the war on drugs has stifled millions in need of help - time to dispel the lies and address the facts.

Documentaries.title: Cartel Land
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Matthew Heineman and Executive Producer Kathryn Bigelow (“The Hurt Locker”, “Zero Dark Thirty”) bring us this unprecedented look at two vigilante groups fighting the murderous drug cartels on both sides of the Mexican border.

Documentaries.title: The Cat Rescuers
Documentaries.description: A dedicated group of people in Brooklyn devote their days and nights to rescuing abandoned or otherwise homeless kittens and cats. Of course, the animals are adorable, but the people are equally inspiring.

Documentaries.title: The Cave
Documentaries.description: The Cave paints a stirring portrait of courage, resilience and female solidarity inside a subterranean hospital in Syria run by a young, female pediatrician.

Documentaries.title: The Challenge
Documentaries.description: Italian visual artist Yuri Ancarani’s exquisite documentary enters the surreal world of wealthy Qatari sheikhs with a passion for amateur falconry. The opulence of this Middle Eastern gas state  is on full display as the men race SUVs up and down sand dunes, fly their prized falcons around on private jets, and take their pet cheetahs out for desert spins in their souped-up Ferraris. The result is a film jaw-dropping not only for its displays of wealth, but for the pure cinematic beauty that won Ancarani the Filmmaker of the Present award at the 2016 Locarno Film Festival.

Documentaries.title: Chef Flynn
Documentaries.description: Ten-year-old Flynn McGarry transforms his living room into a supper club using his classmates as line cooks. Achieving sudden fame, Flynn outgrows his bedroom kitchen and sets out to challenge the hierarchy of the culinary world.

Documentaries.title: The China Hustle
Documentaries.description: From the producers of Enron: The Smartest Guys In The Room, a Wall Street heist story about Chinese companies, the US stock market and a still-unfolding financial crime so big, it has the power to affect all of our wallets.

Documentaries.title: Citizen Jane: Battle for the City
Documentaries.description: Citizen Jane is a timely tale of what can happen when engaged citizens fight the power for the sake of a better world. Arguably no one did more to shape our understanding of the modern American city than Jane Jacobs, the visionary activist and writer who fought to preserve urban communities in the face of destructive development projects. Director Matt Tyranuer (Valentino: The Last Emperor) vividly brings to life Jacobs' 1960s showdown with ruthless construction kingpin Robert Moses over his plan to raze lower Manhattan to make way for a highway, a dramatic struggle over the very soul of the neighborhood.

Documentaries.title: Citizen Soldier
Documentaries.description: The true story of some soldiers in a United States Army Infantry Company, part of the Oklahoma National Guard's 45th Thunderbirds Brigade, and their life-changing tour of duty in Afghanistan.

Documentaries.title: The Clintons: An American Odyssey
Documentaries.description: There is no parallel to the remarkable lives of William and Hillary Clinton - it's all here in an insightful time capsule, telling one of America's greatest personal and political stories.

Documentaries.title: Closing Gambit: 1978 Korchnoi versus Karpov and the Kremlin
Documentaries.description: After Fischer beat Spassky in the 1972 World Chess Championship, the Soviets plotted to regain this coveted title by supporting Anatoly Karpov – a loyal member of the Communist Party and epitome of the young Soviet ‘New Man’.

Documentaries.title: Cold Case Hammarskjöld
Documentaries.description: Danish director Mads Brügger and Swedish private investigator Göran Bjorkdahl are trying to solve the mysterious death of Dag Hammarskjöld. As their investigation closes in, they discover a crime with even farther reaching consequences.

Documentaries.title: A Complete History of My Sexual Failures
Documentaries.description: A hilarious and raunchy true story about a filmmaker who interviews his ex's about why they dumped him to try and figure out why his love life is such a disaster.

Documentaries.title: Comrades & Cash: How Money Found Its Way Through the Iron Curtain
Documentaries.description: Communist East Germany is on the brink of bankruptcy, so it forges dark alliances and created a global businesses network which sold anything possible. This is the true story that inspired Deutschland ’86.

Documentaries.title: The Coolest Guy Movie Ever: Return to the Scene of The Great Escape
Documentaries.description: THE COOLEST GUY MOVIE EVER is the definitive look at the making of the 1963 classic, "The Great Escape."

Documentaries.title: Crazy About Tiffany's
Documentaries.description: A provocative and rare glimpse at the most iconic luxury jeweler in the world. From past to present, discovering the behind the scenes creation to those beholden to its charm, Crazy About Tiffany's unveils Tiffany & Co. like never before.

Documentaries.title: Crime + Punishment
Documentaries.description: This film chronicles the real struggles of a group of whistleblower cops in NYC as they fight back against the illegal arrest quotas they’re pressured to abide by.

Documentaries.title: Culture Shock: A Conversation With Director Gigi Saul Guerrero
Documentaries.description: Director Gigi Saul Guerrero talks through Culture Shock’s themes—immigration, filmmaking, and latinidad—in this one-on-one chat.

Documentaries.title: Cunningham
Documentaries.description: Traces legendary American choreographer Merce Cunningham’s artistic evolution from his early years in postwar New York to his emergence as one of the world’s most visionary choreographers. A breathtaking explosion of dance, music.

Documentaries.title: Danger Close
Documentaries.description: War reporter Alex Quade re-embeds with Green Berets after the death of Special Forces Staff Sgt. Rob Pirelli during a battle in Afghanistan.

Documentaries.title: Dealt
Documentaries.description: Prepare to be inspired and amazed by Richard Turner, one of the world's most renowned card magicians, who met adversity head-on and refused to let his disability define him.

Documentaries.title: Design for All
Documentaries.description: What does design mean? How does it impact us? Design for All examines how an inclusive approach to design affects culture and improves the ways we relate to the built environment, to our communities, and to one another.

Documentaries.title: Destiny in Space
Documentaries.description: "Destiny In Space" provides an inspiring look at the challenges future generations will face in exploring the universe. For the first time on the giant screen, audiences travel outside the space shuttle as it orbits 200 miles above the Earth. Along with thrilling fly-overs of Mars and Venus, the film focuses on the dramatic partnership of humans and robots working in space.

Documentaries.title: Diana Vreeland: The Eye Has to Travel
Documentaries.description: This is an intimate portrait and a vibrant celebration of one of the most influential women of the 20th century, an enduring icon whose influence changed the face of fashion, beauty, art, publishing, and culture forever.

Documentaries.title: Dina
Documentaries.description: In this 2017 Sundance and IDA award-winning film, Dina, an eccentric and outspoken suburban woman and Scott, a Walmart door greeter, navigate their evolving relationship in this unconventional love story.

Documentaries.title: Dior and I
Documentaries.description: Dior and I brings the viewer inside the storied world of the Christian Dior fashion house with a privileged, behind-the-scenes look at the creation of Raf Simons’ first haute couture collection as its new artistic director.

Documentaries.title: Divide and Conquer: The Story of Roger Ailes
Documentaries.description: The rise and fall of Roger Ailes, controversial Fox News mogul and Republican king-maker. One of the most powerful and divisive figures in media, Ailes would go down in flames amid scandal, paranoia, and multiple sexual harassment allegations.

Documentaries.title: Drag Kids
Documentaries.description: Four preteen drag queens come together for the biggest performance of their young lives. As they prepare for the big show, they struggle to claim a place of their own on the fringes of a fringe culture.

Documentaries.title: The Dream Is Alive IMAX
Documentaries.description: "The Dream Is Alive" gives the viewer an unprecedented window on board the space shuttle. Shot by 14 NASA astronauts on three shuttle missions in 1984, the film includes footage of launches and landings, satellite capture and repairs, space walks and an inside look at how the astronauts live in space. Experience the sensation of weightlessness and the splendor of Earth from 250 miles up.

Documentaries.title: Dumb: The Story of Big Brother Magazine
Documentaries.description: The history of the boundary-pushing, taboo-breaking, crassly-humorous Big Brother magazine, that spawned MTV's "Jackass" and a generation of skaters.

Documentaries.title: Dust 2 Glory
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Dana Brown explores the SCORE Baja 1000, the world's toughest, point-to-point desert race.

Documentaries.title: Eating Animals
Documentaries.description: What's on your plate? Natalie Portman and Jonathan Safran Foer present this eye-opening look at the food industry and an ethical future free of factory farming.

Documentaries.title: El Pantera
Documentaries.description: EL PANTERA is a documentary film that chronicles the rise of Mexican MMA star Yair Rodriguez aka El Pantera as he embarks on his journey to become the first ever Mexican born UFC Champion.

Documentaries.title: Far From the Tree
Documentaries.description: Discover the courage of compassion through the eyes of parents journeying towards acceptance of their unique children. Based on The New York Times bestseller.

Documentaries.title: Fine Lines
Documentaries.description: There is something far deeper that drives the world’s most elite group of mountain adventurers to take life threatening risks.  At times brutally honest, other times pensive, these athletes’ stories reveal the triumph of the human spirit.

Documentaries.title: Fires of Kuwait
Documentaries.description: Fires of Kuwait is an eloquent visual testimony to the remarkable resourcefulness and heroism of the men and women who extinguished and controlled over 600 burning and gushing oil wells sabotaged by retreating Iraqi troops in the aftermath of the Gulf War

Documentaries.title: The First Monday in May
Documentaries.description: Follows the creation of The Metropolitan Museum of Art's most attended fashion exhibition in history, "China: Through The Looking Glass," an exploration of Chinese-inspired Western fashions by Costume Institute curator Andrew Bolton.

Documentaries.title: The Flat
Documentaries.description: What begins with the emptying out of a flat develops into a startling exposé of an Israeli family's dark and mysterious relationship with the Nazis.

Documentaries.title: Food Evolution
Documentaries.description: Amidst a brutally polarized debate marked by passion, suspicion and confusion, FOOD EVOLUTION, by Academy Award®-nominated director Scott Hamilton Kennedy (The Garden, Fame High, OT: Our Town), explores the controversy surrounding GMOs and food. Traveling from Hawaiian papaya groves, to banana farms in Uganda to the cornfields of Iowa, the film, narrated by esteemed science communicator Neil deGrasse Tyson, wrestles with the emotions and the science driving one of the most heated arguments of our time.

Documentaries.title: Food, Inc
Documentaries.description: Food Inc. reveals surprising - and often shocking - truths about what we eat, how it's produced, and who we have become as a nation.

Documentaries.title: For Ahkeem
Documentaries.description: After a fight lands Daje Shelton in a court-supervised high school, she is determined to turn things around. ‘For Ahkeem’ illuminates challenges that Black teens face in America today, and the strength it takes to survive.

Documentaries.title: Framing John DeLorean
Documentaries.description: Money, power, politics, drugs, scandal, and fast cars. Discover the untold story of the controversial automaker's meteoric rise and shocking fall. Featuring Alec Baldwin.

Documentaries.title: Frank Serpico
Documentaries.description: The courageous police officer known for exposing corruption within the NYPD and inspiring the Al Pacino classic recounts his incredible story in his own words.

Documentaries.title: Free Solo
Documentaries.description: Free solo climber Alex Honnold prepares to achieve his lifelong dream: scaling the 3,200-foot El Capitan in Yosemite National Park without a rope.

Documentaries.title: Funke
Documentaries.description: Acclaimed Chef Evan Funke mounts his culinary comeback - an ode to the dying art of handmade pasta - on the most competitive street in America where he finds himself fighting to fulfill his artistic destiny while battling the impossibly volatile LA restaurant industry.

Documentaries.title: FYRE FRAUD
Documentaries.description: Fyre Festival was the defining scam of the millennial generation, at the nexus of social media influence, late-stage capitalism, and morality in the post-truth era. Marketing for the 2017 music event went viral with the help of rapper Ja Rule, Instagram stars, and models, but turned epic fail after stranding thousands in the Bahamas. Featuring an exclusive interview with Billy McFarland, the convicted con-man behind the festival; FYRE FRAUD is a true-crime comedy bolstered by a cast of whistleblowers, victims, and insiders going beyond the spectacle to uncover the power of FOMO and an ecosystem of enablers, driven by profit and a lack of accountability in the digital age.

Documentaries.title: Galapagos
Documentaries.description: Journey with marine biologist Dr. Carole Baldwin on an adventure to the famed Galapagos Islands.

Documentaries.title: Gilbert
Documentaries.description: Gilbert Gottfried rose to fame in the 1980’s thanks to his brash stand-up act and personality. Now, after decades of flying solo in both his work and in his personal life, Gilbert has shockingly reinvented himself…as a family man.

Documentaries.title: Glen Campbell: I'll Be Me
Documentaries.description: This film documents Glen's amazing "Goodbye Tour" as he and his family attempt to navigate the wildly unpredictable nature of his progressing Alzheimer's disease using love, laughter and music as their medicine of choice.

Documentaries.title: The Gospel According to André
Documentaries.description: This intimate portrait for André Leon Tally, a fixture in the world of fashion, takes viewers on a journey from André’s roots growing up to becoming one of the most influential tastemakers and fashion curators of our times.

Documentaries.title: Grace Jones: Bloodlight and Bami
Documentaries.description: A larger-than-life entertainer, an androgynous glam-pop diva – Grace Jones is all these things and more. Sophie Fiennes’s documentary goes beyond the traditional music biography, offering a portrait as stylish and unconventional as its subject.

Documentaries.title: Grizzly Man
Documentaries.description: In this mesmerizing new film, acclaimed director Werner Herzog explores the life and death of amateur grizzly bear expert and wildlife preservationist Timothy Treadwell, who lived unarmed among grizzlies for 13 summers.

Documentaries.title: Hail Columbia!
Documentaries.description: Experience one of humankind's crowning achievements -- the inaugural voyage of the world's first space shuttle. Hail Columbia! goes behind the scenes with astronauts John Young and Robert Crippen as they prepare for their historic launch

Documentaries.title: Hail Satan?
Documentaries.description: Hail Satan? offers a look at a group of misunderstood outsiders whose commitment to social and political justice has empowered thousands of people. An inspiring and entertaining documentary from acclaimed director Penny Lane (Nuts!, Our Nixon).

Documentaries.title: Harry Benson: Shoot First
Documentaries.description: Harry Benson: Shoot First charts the illustrious career of the renowned photographer who initially rose to fame alongside The Beatles.

Documentaries.title: Havana Motor Club
Documentaries.description: Cuban drag racers prepare for the first sanctioned race in their country since 1960. This documentary offers a fascinating glimpse at the ingenuity of the competitive spirit.

Documentaries.title: The Heart of Nuba
Documentaries.description: American doctor Tom Catena dedicates his life to treating patients in the Nuba Mountains of war-torn Sudan.

Documentaries.title: Hillbilly
Documentaries.description: Hillbilly seeks to expand understanding of Appalachia, tracing the evolution of the `hillbilly' stereotype in media and culture by connecting it to corporate exploitation of the region's natural resources.

Documentaries.title: Honeyland
Documentaries.description: Hatidze lives with her ailing mother in Macedonia, making a living cultivating honey using ancient beekeeping traditions. When an unruly family moves in next door, what at first seems like a balm for her solitude becomes a source of tension.

Documentaries.title: The Hornet's Nest
Documentaries.description: Journalists Mike and Carlos Boettcher follow U.S. troops during nine harrowing days of combat in Afghanistan.

Documentaries.title: Horses: The Story of Equus IMAX
Documentaries.description: In this documentary, three horses that all come into the world on a single evening at the same farm -- a black, a bay and a chestnut -- face differing futures. All the horses are quickly sold, but each finds a different life waiting for it. The black horse flees his owners and escapes to live a free life in the wilderness. The bay horse is groomed to be a performer, to jump and prance at horse shows. The chestnut horse, meanwhile, is trained to race.

Documentaries.title: Hunt for the Skinwalker
