Documentaries.description: Hundreds of reports of phenomena at Skinwalker Ranch have made it one of the most famous paranormal hotspots in the world. Previously unreleased footage and interviews from the scientific study piece together what could be happening there.

Documentaries.title: Hurley
Documentaries.description: In the 1970’s, Hurley Haywood was the dominant force in motor racing, but his personal life remained a mystery. Hurley chronicles a remarkable life, revealing a greater insight into the tightrope walk between career and personal life.

Documentaries.title: I Am Not Your Negro
Documentaries.description: In 1979, James Baldwin wrote a letter to his literary agent describing his next project, "Remember This House." The book was to be a revolutionary, personal account of the lives and assassinations of three of his close friends: Medgar Evers, Malcolm X and Martin Luther King, Jr. At the time of Baldwin's death in 1987, he left behind only 30 completed pages of this manuscript. Filmmaker Raoul Peck envisions the book James Baldwin never finished.

Documentaries.title: I Know a Woman Like That
Documentaries.description: I KNOW A WOMAN LIKE THAT brings to its audience interviews with 17 exceptional and vigorous women who share an extraordinary attitude about how to live the upper decades of one's life.

Documentaries.title: I, Dolours
Documentaries.description: Go deep inside the IRA, charting one woman’s journey from passionate idealist into disillusioned cynic, haunted by the memories of the terrible things she did for a cause she once so strongly believed in for which she was ultimately betrayed.

Documentaries.title: In Search of Greatness
Documentaries.description: IN SEARCH OF GREATNESS is a groundbreaking documentary that reveals the true nature and nurture of the greatest athletes of all time

Documentaries.title: Into the Deep
Documentaries.description: Into the Deep takes you on a spectacular exploration of the undersea world. The film captures unique marine life and magnificent underwater vistas. Dive under the sea to the kelp forests off the southern coast of California

Documentaries.title: Into the Night: Portraits of Life and Death
Documentaries.description: To be human is to wrestle with this truth and with the great unanswered question: How do we live with death in our eye? Into the Night features men and women of uncommon eloquence and intelligence who are grappling with these questions.

Documentaries.title: Iris
Documentaries.description: From legendary documentarian Albert Maysles (GREY GARDENS, GIMME SHELTER), IRIS pairs the late 88-year-old filmmaker with Iris Apfel, the quick-witted, flamboyantly dressed 93-year-old style maven who has had an outsized presence on the New York fashion scene for decades. More than a fashion film, the documentary is a story about creativity and how a soaring free spirit continues to inspire.

Documentaries.title: JACO
Documentaries.description: "JACO" tells the story of Jaco Pastorius, a self-taught, larger-than-life musician who single-handedly changed the course of modern music by redefining the sound and the role of the electric bass guitar.

Documentaries.title: Jane
Documentaries.description: Director Brett Morgen presents an intimate portrait of Jane Goodall's groundbreaking chimpanzee research.

Documentaries.title: Janis: Little Girl Blue
Documentaries.description: Academy® Award nominated director Amy Berg strips away Janis’ rock ‘n roll persona to reveal the raw, sensitive, innocent, uncensored and powerful woman behind the legend.

Documentaries.title: Jawline
Documentaries.description: This film follows 16-year-old Austyn Tester, a rising star in the live-broadcast ecosystem who built his following on wide-eyed optimism and teen girl lust, as he tries to escape a dead-end life in rural Tennessee.

Documentaries.title: Jesus Camp
Documentaries.description: Jesus camp follows three kids to Pastor Becky Fischer's "Kids on Fire" camp where young kids are taught to become Christian soldiers in "God's army." The kids hone their "prophetic gifts" and are schooled in how to "take back America for Christ."

Documentaries.title: Journey to the South Pacific
Documentaries.description: Jawi, a boy living on a tropical island in West Papua, encounters whale sharks, sea turtles and other creatures of the sea.

Documentaries.title: Julian Schnabel: A Private Portrait
Documentaries.description: Julian Schnabel: A Private Portrait chronicles the personal life and public career of the celebrated painter and filmmaker Julian Schnabel, whose acclaimed work has turned him into a superstar in the international art world.

Documentaries.title: Just Eat It: A Food Waste Story
Documentaries.description: Filmmakers and food lovers, Jen and Grant dive into the issue of food waste from farm and retail, right to the back of their own fridge. In a deliciously entertaining challenge, they pledge to quit grocery shopping and survive only on discarded food.

Documentaries.title: Justin Bieber: Never Say Never
Documentaries.description: Justin Bieber: Never Say Never is the inspiring true story and rare inside look at the rise of Justin from street performer in the small town of Stratford, Ontario to global super star.

Documentaries.title: K2: Beyond the Comfort Zone
Documentaries.description: Adventurer Mike Horn and his friends travel through 13 countries in an  attempt  to  ascend the  most  difficult mountain  in  the world. Immersing  into different cultures and breathtaking landscapes, they get closer to climbing K2.

Documentaries.title: Kiki
Documentaries.description: 25 years after 'Paris Is Burning' introduced the art of voguing to the world, Kiki revisits New York City's thriving underground ballroom scene. It's a larger-than-life world in which LGBTQ youths of color are empowered by staging elaborate dance competitions that showcase their dynamic choreography, fabulous costumes, and fierce attitude. It's also a safe haven for struggling, at-risk teens who find acceptance, support, and friendship within the Kiki community. Granted intimate access to the scene, filmmaker Sara Jordenö introduces viewers to some of Kiki culture's most prominent personalities, going beyond the glamour of the balls to highlight the serious challenges facing queer black and Latino young people. Bringing together heartrending personal stories with incredible displays of creative expression, Kiki is 'exhilarating…an indelible, must-see ode to gay New York' (Manohla Dargis, The New York Times).

Documentaries.title: Killing for Love
Documentaries.description: What could drive an innocent man to take the fall for a crime he didn't commit? A shocking true tale of obsessive love, betrayal, and murder.

Documentaries.title: Kim Dotcom: Caught in the Web
Documentaries.description: Kim Dotcom, the "most wanted man online," battles the U.S. government and entertainment industry over issues of ownership, privacy and piracy in the digital age.

Documentaries.title: Kusama: Infinity
Documentaries.description: The top-selling female artist in the world, Yayoi Kusama overcame impossible odds to bring her radical artistic vision to the world stage. People are experiencing her installation Infinity Mirrored Rooms, as she continues to create new work every day.

Documentaries.title: Kygo: Stole the Show - Director's Cut
Documentaries.description: Stole The Show, featuring Bono, Steve Aoki, and Martin Garrix, drops us into the heart of the music streaming revolution, using Kygo's first arena show as a lens to examine not only Kygo's rise but the rise of streaming.

Documentaries.title: LA 92
Documentaries.description: Twenty-five years after the verdict in the Rodney King trial sparked several days of protests, violence and looting in Los Angeles, LA 92 immerses viewers in that tumultuous period through stunning and rarely seen archival footage.

Documentaries.title: Larger Than Life: The Kevyn Aucoin Story
Documentaries.description: A pioneer of contour techniques, makeup artist Kevyn Aucoin’s meteoric rise to fame in the 80’s and 90’s was legendary. Iconic clients, friends, and family retrace his life, career, and mysterious death at the height of his fame in 2002.

Documentaries.title: The Last Animals
Documentaries.description: In this sweeping and sobering exposé, conflict photographer Kate Brooks turns her lens from the war zones she is used to covering to a new kind of genocide - the killing of African elephants and rhinos.

Documentaries.title: The Last Race
Documentaries.description: The DNA of NASCAR, independent stock car racing is a dying art that’s still hanging on at an iconic Long Island track. Electrifying racing footage is intertwined with the story of a small town trying to retain its identity.

Documentaries.title: Le Ride
Documentaries.description: Phil Keoghan (The Amazing Race), the television personality, adventurer and bike enthusiast, sets out to retrace the route of the 1928 Tour de France. Following the original course, Phil and his team will try and average 150 miles a day for 22 days.

Documentaries.title: Leaning Into the Wind: Andy Goldsworthy
Documentaries.description: Sixteen years after the groundbreaking film Rivers and Tides director Thomas Riedelsheimer returns to work with the artist. The film follows Andy on his exploration of the layers of his world and the impact of the years on himself and his art.

Documentaries.title: Legion of Brothers
Documentaries.description: Immediately after the 9/11 attacks, less than 100 US Troops were sent on a secret mission to overthrow the Taliban. What happens next is equal parts war origin story & cautionary tale, illuminating the impact of 15 years of constant combat.

Documentaries.title: Life, Animated
Documentaries.description: From Academy Award® winning director Roger Ross Williams comes the story of Owen Suskind, a young man who couldn’t speak as a child until he discovered a unique way to communicate by immersing himself in the world of Disney animated films.

Documentaries.title: Lo and Behold: Reveries of the Connected World
Documentaries.description: Oscar®-nominated documentarian Werner Herzog (Grizzly Man, Cave of Forgotten Dreams) chronicles the virtual world from its origins to its outermost reaches.

Documentaries.title: Long Time Coming: A 1955 Baseball Story
Documentaries.description: Sixty years after integrating Little League baseball in the South, the pioneering players embark on a personal journey and question the ballgame’s historic significance while trying to navigate America’s lingering racial divisions.

Documentaries.title: Lost in Vagueness
Documentaries.description: Lost in Vagueness is the incomparable story of the legendary backstage after-hour area 'Lost Vagueness' at the Glastonbury Festival, the largest music and culture festival in the world.

Documentaries.title: Love, Gilda
Documentaries.description: A joyous, moving celebration of the life of the first superstar of Saturday Night Live. Gilda Radner's jubilant spark is captured through private audiotapes, home movies and diaries in this salute to her indomitable spirit.

Documentaries.title: Madonna and the Breakfast Club
Documentaries.description: The incredible untold story of pop icon Madonna’s struggling pre-fame years in New York City with her musician boyfriend, Dan Gilroy, and their first band Breakfast Club.

Documentaries.title: March of the Penguins
Documentaries.description: Morgan Freeman narrates this Oscar(R)-winning documentary about the amazing annual journey of the emperor penguins of Antarctica.

Documentaries.title: March of the Penguins 2: The Next Step
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Luc Jacquet returns to the Antarctic to visit the Emperor Penguins who call the frozen continent home. March of the Penguins 2, tells the story of two penguins, as they face the unimaginable challenges of life in this hostile land.

Documentaries.title: Margaret Atwood: A Word After a Word After a Word is Power
Documentaries.description: Poet and novelist, Margaret Atwood is a household name. Yet few know the private Margaret Atwood. Who is the woman and writer behind these stories?

Documentaries.title: Marianne & Leonard: Words of Love
Documentaries.description: A story of enduring love between Leonard Cohen and his Norwegian muse, Marianne Ihlen. Filmmaker Nick Broomfield chronicles their relationship, from the early days in Greece to how their love evolved when Leonard became a successful musician.

Documentaries.title: Meeting Gorbachev
Documentaries.description: Werner Herzog meeting Mikhail Gorbachev opens a fresh door to some of the most significant happenings of the late 20th Century from nuclear disarmament to the reunification of Germany and the end of the Cold War.

Documentaries.title: Michael Jackson: Life, Death and Legacy
Documentaries.description: Following the recent imprisonment of Jackson's doctor Conrad Murray for involuntary manslaughter, we are taken on a journey through the extraordinary life of Michael Jackson from his debut in the Jackson 5 to his untimely death in 2009.

Documentaries.title: Mike Wallace Is Here
Documentaries.description: An unflinching look at the legendary reporter, who interrogated the 20th century’s biggest figures in his over fifty years on air, and his aggressive reporting style and showmanship that redefined what America came to expect from broadcasters.

Documentaries.title: Minding the Gap
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Bing Liu searches for correlations between his skateboarder friends' turbulent upbringings and the complexities of modern-day masculinity.

Documentaries.title: Miss Snake Charmer
Documentaries.description: Miss Snake Charmer contestants are not your typical high school beauty queens. The teens must show they are more than just pretty faces-that they have the guts and grit to win America's toughest beauty pageant.

Documentaries.title: Missing 411
Documentaries.description: Based on the books series written by David Paulides Missing 411 chronicles the unsolved yet eerily similar disappearances of five children in the wilds of North America across multiple decades.

Documentaries.title: Monkey Business: The Adventures of Curious George’s Creators
Documentaries.description: Featuring a narrow escape from the Nazis on makeshift bicycles, MONKEY BUSINESS explores the extraordinary lives of Hans and Margret Rey, the authors of the beloved Curious George children’s books.

Documentaries.title: My Scientology Movie
Documentaries.description: Documentarian Louis Theroux is denied admittance to the Church of Scientology's headquarters, setting into motion a clever, confrontational and funny plan to try and reveal the inner workings of the mysterious organization.

Documentaries.title: Neat: The Story of Bourbon
Documentaries.description: "Neat" dives into the rich and storied world of bourbon. Exploring its colorful history, charismatic characters, and uniquely American process, the film is a celebration of the artistry that makes America’s only native spirit.

Documentaries.title: Nick Nolte: No Exit
Documentaries.description: Actor Nick Nolte interviews himself.

Documentaries.title: Noma My Perfect Storm
Documentaries.description: Creative genius René Redzepi is renowned as one of the world’s best chefs. His restaurant Noma was voted best restaurant in the world four times.

Documentaries.title: Obey Giant
Documentaries.description: A documentary that profiles the life and work of artist Shepard Fairey, following his roots in punk rock and skateboarding to his creation of the iconic Obama HOPE poster and the controversy that surrounds it.

Documentaries.title: Once Were Brothers: Robbie Robertson and The Band
Documentaries.description: A moving story of Robertson’s personal journey, overcoming adversity and finding camaraderie alongside the four other men who would become his brothers in one of the most enduring groups in the history of popular music, THE BAND.

Documentaries.title: Own the Sky
Documentaries.description: Three men try to build and fly a jet pack.

Documentaries.title: The Painter and the Thief
Documentaries.description: Desperate for answers about the theft of her 2 paintings, a Czech artist befriends the criminal who stole them. After inviting her thief to sit for a portrait, they form an relationship and bond that will forever link these lonely souls.

Documentaries.title: The Panama Papers
Documentaries.description: Director Alex Winter goes inside the biggest global corruption scandal in history that was uncovered by hundreds of journalists, working in secret and at enormous risk.

Documentaries.title: Pandas
Documentaries.description: Join narrator Kristen Bell in Pandas, a heartwarming story about the adventures of Qian Qian, a captive-born giant panda cub who's destined for life in the wild.

Documentaries.title: Pick of the Litter
Documentaries.description: Five spirited Labrador puppies embark on an incredible journey to become guide dogs for the blind. Which ones will have what it takes?

Documentaries.title: Pigeon Kings
Documentaries.description: Pigeons do somersaults in mid-flight, and there is a subculture of men in South Central L.A. devoted to this phenomenon as a competitive sport. The former champion mentors an up-and-comer, and together they prepare for the World Cup.

Documentaries.title: Public Figure
Documentaries.description: A documentary that investigates the psychological effects of everyday social media use while exploring how our influencers deal with the fame, money, hate, and obsession that comes with it.

Documentaries.title: The Push
Documentaries.description: Two years after a debilitating accident, Grant Korgan becomes the first spinal cord injured athlete to actually push himself 100 miles to the geographic South Pole.

Documentaries.title: The Queen of Versailles
Documentaries.description: The Queen of Versailles is a character-driven documentary about a billionaire family and their financial challenges in the wake of the economic crisis.

Documentaries.title: The Quest of Alain Ducasse
Documentaries.description: Alain Ducasse is one of the world’s most renowned chefs and culinary mentors. He tirelessly travels the world smelling, tasting, touching and fearlessly creating ground-breaking new cuisine. French, subtitled in English.

Documentaries.title: The Quiet One
Documentaries.description: He was the bassist for The Rolling Stones and known as the "quiet one." Now, Bill Wyman speaks out about life in the world’s greatest rock band through a tour of his personal archive.

Documentaries.title: Raise Hell: The Life and Times of Molly Ivins
Documentaries.description: Raise Hell: The Life and Times of Molly Ivins tells the story of media firebrand Molly Ivins, six feet of Texas trouble who took on the Good Old Boy corruption wherever she found it.

Documentaries.title: The Rape of Recy Taylor
Documentaries.description: In 1944, when African-American wife and mother Recy Taylor is gang raped by seven white men in Alabama, she speaks out against her attackers, putting herself and her family in danger.

Documentaries.title: RBG
Documentaries.description: An intimate portrait of an unlikely rock star: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. With unprecedented access, the filmmakers explore how her early legal battles changed the world for women.

Documentaries.title: The Reagan Show
Documentaries.description: Told solely through archival footage and set against the backdrop of the Cold War, The Reagan Show presents the pageantry, absurdity, and charisma of a prolific actor’s defining role: Leader of the Free World.

Documentaries.title: The Reckoning
Documentaries.description: Powerful, personal and uncensored, The Reckoning explores the most explosive scandal in pop culture’s history: sexual misconduct in Hollywood.

Documentaries.title: Red Dog
Documentaries.description: Hit songwriter Luke Dick spent his childhood  in the rowdiest strip club in OKC, the Red Dog. 30 years later, he began questioning his former stripper mom about his childhood- and she turned out more hilariously frank than he ever imagined.

Documentaries.title: Religulous
Documentaries.description: Bill Maher goes on a humorous pilgrimage around the world to question people's faith and find out why they believe in God.

Documentaries.title: Respectable: The Mary Millington Story
Documentaries.description: The extraordinary rise to fame and tragic death of Britain's most famous pornographic actress.

Documentaries.title: The Riot and the Dance: Earth
Documentaries.description: Join in the glorious uproar of creation with Dr. Gordon Wilson as he traverses the planet, basking in God’s masterpieces found throughout the animal kingdom.

Documentaries.title: Saving Atlantis
Documentaries.description: Saving Atlantis focuses on the loss of coral reef ecosystems around the world, and the impact of that decline on the communities that depend on them, on a global journey that celebrates the majesty and mystery of coral habitats

Documentaries.title: Saving Jaws
Documentaries.description: Biologist OCEAN RAMSEY (“Shark Whisper") credits her connection with sharks to years of research, but others feel it’s something more. Join Ocean and a team of biologists as they travel the globe trying to halt their looming extinction.

Documentaries.title: School Life
Documentaries.description: This documentary follows a year in the lives of two inspirational teachers at the only primary-age boarding school in Ireland. For nearly half a century they have shaped thousands of minds, but the unthinkable looms: what would retirement mean?

Documentaries.title: Scotch: A Golden Dream
Documentaries.description: For more than a century, Scotch whisky has been the premier international spirit of choice. With a backdrop of stunning Scottish landscapes, explore the artistic and scientific building blocks of making whisky; the stuff dreams are made of.

Documentaries.title: Sea of Shadows
Documentaries.description: Sea of Shadows uncovers a black market that threatens the extinction of the vaquita.

Documentaries.title: The Search for General Tso
Documentaries.description: This mouthwateringly entertaining documentary traces the surprising origins of the iconic Chinese-American dish, from Shanghai to Middle America and beyond.

Documentaries.title: The Secret of Life on Earth
Documentaries.description: Breathtaking in its scope, "The Secret Of Life On Earth" celebrates life from its origins four billion years ago. Brilliant use of micro, macro, and time-lapse photography, coupled with a remarkable music score, reinforces the film's message: the beauty, fragility and interdependence of all forms of life, and our crucial role in their survival.

Documentaries.title: Sharp Edges
Documentaries.description: Sharp Edges is an intimate look into the early years of figure skater, Tonya Harding. Featuring early interviews with Tonya, as well as her coaches and mother (portrayed by Oscar (R)-winning Allison Janney in I, TONYA).

Documentaries.title: The Shock Doctrine
Documentaries.description: Filmmakers Michael Winterbottom and Mat Whitecross use lectures by Naomi Klein, newsreel footage and analysis to explain the connection between politics and economics.

Documentaries.title: Slay the Dragon
Documentaries.description: Activists work to rid gerrymandering from America's election process.

Documentaries.title: Sneakerheadz
Documentaries.description: An in-depth look into the exploding subculture of sneaker collecting and the widespread influence it has had on popular culture around the world.

Documentaries.title: Somm
Documentaries.description: The story of four sommeliers attempting to pass the prestigious Master Sommelier exam, a test with one of the lowest pass rates in the world.

Documentaries.title: Somm 3
Documentaries.description: Three of the greatest legends in wine meet to drink the rarest bottles of their careers, while the best blind tasters of today gather to settle an age-old argument. The results could change the world of wine forever.

Documentaries.title: Somm: Into The Bottle
Documentaries.description: The seldom seen world that surrounds the wine we drink. How is it grown? What goes on in the cellar? This is a never before seen look into the world of wine.

Documentaries.title: Soufra
Documentaries.description: The film follows Mariam and a diverse team of fellow refugee women who call their camp home as they set out to change their fate by launching a catering company, ‘Soufra’, and then expand its reach outside the camp with a food truck business.

Documentaries.title: Space Station
Documentaries.description: Travel 220 miles above Earth at 17,500 mph to experience the greatest engineering feat since landing a man on the Moon. Space Station is the story of a unique partnership of 16 nations building a laboratory in outer space -- a permanent facility

Documentaries.title: Spaceship Earth
Documentaries.description: In 1991 a group of countercultural visionaries built an enormous replica of earth’s ecosystem called Biosphere 2.  Their epic adventure is a cautionary tale but also a testament to the power of small groups reimagining the world.

Documentaries.title: Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine
Documentaries.description: Academy Award®-winning director Alex Gibney [Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief] pulls no punches in his portrait of Apple founder Steve Jobs and his legacy.

Documentaries.title: Superpower Dogs
Documentaries.description: Follow six dogs and their human partners as they brave earthquakes and avalanches, protect endangered species and help people with special needs.

Documentaries.title: Survival Island
Documentaries.description: Penguins and sea lions migrate to South Georgia Island in spring and summer.

Documentaries.title: Take Every Wave: The Life of Laird Hamilton
Documentaries.description: Experience the white-knuckle thrill of big wave surfing through the eyes of Laird Hamilton, a living legend who conquers the world's mightiest tides.

Documentaries.title: Take My Nose... Please!
Documentaries.description: Two comedians, Emily Askin and Jackie Hoffman, debate the merits and pitfalls of plastic surgery as they deliberate about going under the knife.

Documentaries.title: Tea With the Dames
Documentaries.description: Spend a delightfully bawdy afternoon with 4 legends of British stage & cinema. Dames Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Eileen Atkins, and Joan Plowright spill the tea on life, love, and art.

Documentaries.title: That Summer
Documentaries.description: Welcome to GREY GARDENS...as you've never seen it before. Discover the long-lost film featuring Big and Little Edie before they were cultural icons. With Andy Warhol.

Documentaries.title: This Mountain Life
Documentaries.description: Martina and her 60-year-old mother embark on a 6-month ski trek through the treacherous Coast Mountains of BC. Their adventure is interspersed with five beautifully crafted portraits of high-altitude human endurance and passion.

Documentaries.title: This One's for the Ladies
Documentaries.description: Every Thursday night, hundreds of women gather for a potluck celebration and the chance to throw singles at the hottest dancers in New Jersey. This One's for the Ladies isn't just about  dancing, it's a heartwarming story of friendship and community.

Documentaries.title: Three Identical Strangers
Documentaries.description: Identical triplets become separated at birth and adopted by three different families. Years later, their amazing reunion becomes a global sensation but also unearths an unimaginable secret that has radical repercussions.

Documentaries.title: Tickled
Documentaries.description: In this shocking documentary you have to see to believe, a pop-culture journalist investigates 'competitive endurance tickling.'

Documentaries.title: Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie
Documentaries.description: In her 59 years, Barbie has become a fashion icon, a lightning rod, and a target for feminists. Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie, featuring newly discovered footage and unprecedented access to the inner workings of a toy giant during Barbie’s biggest reinvention, surveys 60 years of women in popular culture through the lens of this 11.5 inch, Zelig-like plastic icon. Featuring interviews with Gloria Steinem, Roxane Gay, Peggy Orenstein, Mattel insiders and cultural historians, the documentary reveals, through both funny and crushing archival material, and fly-on-the-wall observations of Barbie’s current architects, the progression and regression in women’s fight for equality.

Documentaries.title: Toni Morrison: The Pieces I Am
Documentaries.description: This artful and intimate meditation on legendary storyteller Toni Morrison examines her life, her work and the powerful themes she has confronted throughout her literary career.

Documentaries.title: Too Funny to Fail: The Life & Death of The Dana Carvey Show
Documentaries.description: Why did "The Dana Carvey Show," with a writer’s room and cast including then unknowns Steve Carell, Stephen Colbert, Robert Smigel, and more, flop so spectacularly? "Too Funny to Fail" tells the true story of genius misfits who set out to make comedy history.

Documentaries.title: Two Trains Runnin'
Documentaries.description: Two Trains Runnin' is about the search for two forgotten blues singers, set in Mississippi during the height of the civil rights movement. Directed by Sam Pollard, narrated by Common, and featuring the music of Gary Clark Jr.

Documentaries.title: The U.S. vs. John Lennon
Documentaries.description: The story traces John Lennon's life from the period 1966 to 1976, where Lennon transforms into an antiwar activist, one in constant conflict with the U.S. government and its views.

Documentaries.title: Unacknowledged: An Exposé of the Greatest Secret in Human History
Documentaries.description: Disclosure Project founder Dr. Steven M. Greer offers evidence of extraterrestrial contact, including top-secret testimonials, documents and never-before-seen UFO footage.

Documentaries.title: Unbanned: The Legend of AJ1
Documentaries.description: Unbanned explores the dynamic life of AJ1 from its unlikely origins to its role in disrupting NBA rules, birthing sneaker culture, and influencing a social and cultural revolution. This is the story of a shoe that changed the world.

Documentaries.title: Untouchable
Documentaries.description: The inside story of the rise and fall of Harvey Weinstein reveals how, over decades, he acquires and protects his power even as scandal threatens to engulf him.

Documentaries.title: We Are Columbine
Documentaries.description: On April 20, 1999, Columbine High School in Littleton, Colorado experienced one of the most deadly school shootings in United States history. The incident shocked a country that could scarcely imagine the epidemic of teen violence it foreshadowed.

Documentaries.title: We Are Freestyle Love Supreme
Documentaries.description: Well before the world knew of the Tony award-winning Broadway musicals Hamilton and In The Heights, Lin-Manuel Miranda was in an improvisational hip-hop group called Freestyle Love Supreme along with director Thomas Kail and performers Christopher Jackson and Anthony Veneziale. Filmmaker Andrew Fried began chronicling the group in the summer of 2005, documenting the early days of Freestyle Love Supreme beatboxing and rapping on the sidewalks—unaware of how their story would unfold. Fourteen years later, Fried captures them reuniting for a series of shows in New York City that led to a triumphant run on Broadway. Both poignant and inspired, We Are Freestyle Love Supreme recalls the creative dreams of youth and why this show still means so much to these accomplished performers.

Documentaries.title: Who Let the Dogs Out
Documentaries.description: The origin story of the smash hit "Who Let the Dogs Out"; a story steeped in legal battles, female empowerment and artist integrity, which all beckons the question: will we ever know who let the dogs out?

Documentaries.title: Whose Streets?
Documentaries.description: Told by the activists and leaders who live and breathe this movement for justice, Whose Streets? is an unflinching look at the Ferguson uprising. When unarmed teenager Michael Brown is killed by police and left lying in the street for hours, it marks a breaking point for the residents of St. Louis, Missouri. Grief, long-standing racial tensions and renewed anger bring residents together to hold vigil and protest this latest tragedy. Empowered parents, artists, and teachers from around the country come together as freedom fighters. As the National Guard descends on Ferguson with military grade weaponry, these young community members become the torchbearers of a new resistance. Filmmakers Sabaah Folayan and Damon Davis know this story because they are the story. Whose Streets? is a powerful battle cry from a generation fighting, not for their civil rights, but for the right to live.

Documentaries.title: The Wolfpack
Documentaries.description: The Wolfpack is a coming of age story following the six Angulo brothers who have spent their entire lives locked away from society in an apartment on the Lower East Side of Manhattan.

Documentaries.title: Wrinkles the Clown
Documentaries.description: It started with a YouTube video: a sleeping child, oblivious to the clown slowly emerging from under her bed. Soon, more mysterious videos surfaced. Wrinkles The Clown explores the internet phenomenon and the hysteria it inspired.

Documentaries.title: You Laugh But It's True
Documentaries.description: In the world of stand-up comedy in South Africa, Trevor Noah uses his experiences during Apartheid to prepare for the biggest show of his life.

Drama.description: Jack O'Connell is a British solider accidentally abandoned on the streets of Belfast in 1971. Alone, he must survive the night within enemy lines.

Drama.title: (Dub) Grave of the Fireflies
Drama.description: In the final months of World War II, 14-year-old Seita and his sister Setsuko are orphaned. With no surviving relatives and their emergency rations depleted, they struggle to survive in this heartbreaking story detailing the true casualties of war.

Drama.title: (Sub) Fairy Tail the Movie: Phoenix Priestess
Drama.description: Natsu and his mighty team of mages face evil rising from the embers in this action-packed feature-length exclusive! When a prince seeking immortality unleashes an ancient force, a raging war becomes the fiercest inferno the wizards have ever faced!

Drama.title: (Sub) Grave of the Fireflies
Drama.description: In the final months of World War II, 14-year-old Seita and his sister Setsuko are orphaned. With no surviving relatives and their emergency rations depleted, they struggle to survive in this heartbreaking story detailing the true casualties of war.

Drama.title: 100 Streets
Drama.description: Three people, three extraordinary stories. All lived out within a hundred London streets.

Drama.title: 12 and Holding
Drama.description: Three teens navigating the dark side of suburbia are forced to make sense of some very adult issues in this film from Michael Cuesta (L.I.E.).

Drama.title: The 12th Man
Drama.description: Nazis hunt for a lone surviving saboteur in this edge-of-your-seat WWII thriller based on a true-life story. Jonathan Rhys-Meyers stars.

Drama.title: 13 Assassins
Drama.description: Cult director Takashi Miike (Ichi the Killer, Audition) delivers a bravado period action film set at the end of Japan’s feudal era. 13 Assassins is centered around a group of elite samurai who are secretly enlisted to bring down a sadistic lord.

Drama.title: 2 Days in Paris
Drama.description: 2 Days in Paris, follows a New York couple, French photographer Marion (Julie Delpy), and American interior designer Jack (Adam Goldberg), as they attempt to re-infuse their relationship with romance on a European vacation.

Drama.title: 24 Hour Love
Drama.description: Seven people (Lynn Whitfield, Darius McCrary, Angell Conwell) experience laughter, life and matters of the heart.

Drama.title: 28 Hotel Rooms
Drama.description: On a business trip a married woman and a novelist have a 1 night stand.  Their affair turns into a relationship when they run into each other a year later.

Dylan Branson (Michiel Huisman) begins to notice the repetition of ominous events that happen at the same time every day. As he’s drawn into a complex relationship with Sarah (Teresa Palmer), Dylan must and take control of time itself.

Drama.title: A 2nd Chance
Drama.description: A young girl and her coach overcome adversity to make their way into the National Gymnastics Competition.

Drama.title: The 33
Drama.description: The 2010 Chilean mine disaster and the 69-day effort to rescue the 33 miners who were trapped underground is chronicled.

Drama.title: 4 Lovers
Drama.description: In this sexy, French romantic drama, two couples decide to explore the boundaries of their relationships by swapping partners.

Drama.title: 4th Man Out
Drama.description: Adam, a small-town mechanic, decides it’s time to tell his friends and family he’s gay. Will his straight-as-an-arrow best bros have his back? A lighthearted and unexpectedly subversive comedy about coming out of the blue-collar closet.

Drama.title: 52 Pick-Up
Drama.description: A wealthy industrialist's career and domestic life are threatened when he is caught in a compromising position with a young girl and is subsequently blackmailed.

Drama.title: Above the Shadows
Drama.description: A supernatural tale starring Olivia Thirlby, Alan Ritchson, Jim Gaffigan, Maria Dizzia, Tito Ortiz, David Johansen, and Megan Fox following an invisible woman who must find her way back with the help of the one man who can see her.

Drama.title: Absolute Power
Drama.description: A jewel thief has to prove his innocence after being framed for a murder involving the U.S. president.

Drama.title: Acrimony
Drama.description: In Tyler Perry's sexy and electrifying thriller, a faithful wife (Taraji. P. Henson) is driven over the edge when it becomes clear she has been betrayed.

Drama.title: Affairs of State
Drama.description: A young DC aide kickstarts his government career by sleeping with powerful women. But after seducing a candidate's daughter, he learns the game of politics can be a deadly one.

Drama.title: After Darkness
Drama.description: Natalia Dyer ("Stranger Things") and Kyra Sedgwick ("The Closer") highlight this apocalyptic sci-fi thriller about a family's fight to survive a solar disaster.

Drama.title: Air Strike
Drama.description: Starring Bruce Willis and Adrien Brody and featuring thrilling dogfight action, this intense epic portrays China's brave battle to stop the Japanese bomber strikes of WWII.

Drama.title: All About E
Drama.description: A sexy young DJ, E, and her gay best friend, Matt, are forced to run when E stumbles on some cash. But E finds she has burnt too many bridges and there is nowhere to run but outback Australia into the arms of the ex-girlfriend, Trish, who broke her heart.

Drama.title: Allure
Drama.description: Although Laura works as a house cleaner for her father's company, her personal life is not so pristine. Rough around the edges, looking for love in all the wrong places, her behavior points to hardships of the past. One day Laura meets Eva, a quiet teenager who is unhappy with her disciplined life. In Eva, Laura rediscovers an innocent tenderness. In Laura, Eva finds a thrilling rebel who can bring her into unknown territories. Their mutual attraction soon morphs into obsession.

Drama.title: Almost Adults
Drama.description: A platonic love story about two life long best friends struggling to keep their friendship together as their lives head in different directions.

Drama.title: Along With the Gods: The Two Worlds
Drama.description: In this action-packed fantasy epic, a firefighter is taken to the afterlife by three guardians, where only after passing seven trials and proving he lived a noble life will he be able to reincarnate.

Drama.title: Alright Now
Drama.description: ALRIGHT NOW follows a rock musician (Cobie Smulders, “How I Met Your Mother”) who drunkenly enrolls in college after she breaks up with her boyfriend and her rock band falls apart....what could go wrong?

Drama.title: Anchor and Hope
Drama.description: A lesbian couple, living a simple life, decide to have a child. A comedy starring Oona Chaplin and her mother Geraldine Chaplin.

Drama.title: And So It Goes
Drama.description: A self-absorbed realtor enlists the help of his neighbor when he's suddenly left in charge of the granddaughter he never knew existed until his estranged son drops her off at his home.

Drama.title: Angel of Mine
Drama.description: In this intense thriller, Noomi Rapace stars as a woman on the edge who believes the daughter of a neighbor is actually her own.

Drama.title: Angels in the Snow
Drama.description: The dysfunctional Montgomery family go to their cabin for Christmas where a blizzard traps them inside. When the Tucker family arrives needing shelter, they are welcomed inside and remind the Montgomery family how to love each other.

Drama.title: Aniara
Drama.description: A spaceship carrying settlers to Mars is knocked off course, causing the consumption-obsessed passengers to consider their place in the universe.

Drama.title: Any Given Sunday
Drama.description: Academy Award winner Al Pacino and Cameron Diaz lead a stellar cast in Oscar winner Oliver Stone's hard-hitting homage to the gridiron gladiators of Any Given Sunday.

Drama.title: Anywhere But Here
Drama.description: A free-spirited woman in search of a better life leaves her husband and drives to L.A. with her teenage daughter.

Drama.title: Arbitrage
Drama.description: Richard Gere leads an all-star cast in an electrifying thriller about a hedge-fund magnate whose fortunes turn when a deadly error threatens to destroy both his financial empire and his family.

Drama.title: The Assistant
Drama.description: Jane, a recent college graduate and aspiring film producer, just landed her dream job as a junior assistant to a powerful entertainment mogul. Her day is much like any other assistant -- making coffee, ordering lunch, arranging travel accommodations and taking phone messages. But as Jane follows her daily routine, she grows increasingly aware of the abuse that insidiously colors every aspect of her workday, an accumulation of degradations against which she decides to take a stand.

Drama.title: Astronaut
Drama.description: One old man, one last dream - one golden ticket to the stars.

Drama.title: Australia
Drama.description: Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman star in this sweeping epic about an English woman who finds tragedy, danger and passion in Australia.

Drama.title: Awaiting
Drama.description: Morris is a recluse with psychotic tendencies, whose life changes when his innocent daughter rescues one of his victims and befriends him.

Drama.title: AWOL
Drama.description: Joey joins the Army as a way out of Pennsylvania coal country just as she falls in love with magnetic housewife Rayna. A splendid meditation on the boundless possibilities of first love constricted by the trials of poverty.

Drama.title: Back to Christmas
Drama.description: Ali wakes realizing she's reliving a past Christmas allowing her to change the path of her love life with her ex or with someone entirely unexpected!

Drama.title: Bad Company
Drama.description: Adventurous tale of two young drifters who wildly rob their way West during the Civil War.

Drama.title: The Bank Job
Drama.description: A 1971 bank heist yields not just a fortune but a wealth of state secrets.

Drama.title: Beach Rats
Drama.description: BEACH RATS follows a teenage Frankie (Harris Dickinson) on the outer edges of Brooklyn as he struggles to reconcile his competing sexual desires, leaving him hurtling towards irreparable consequences.

Drama.title: Because I Said So
Drama.description: Diane Keaton stars with Mandy Moore and Lauren Graham in this comedy about a worried mother who meddles in her daughter's love life, doing all the wrong things for all the right reasons.

Drama.title: Bees Make Honey
Drama.description: Bees Make Honey is a stylish 1930’s British comedy murder mystery set during a raucous party in a stately manor home. Based on true events from World War II, the language and mood offers a throwback to period rhythms with a modern ironic twist.

Drama.title: Before I Go to Sleep
Drama.description: A woman wakes up every day, remembering nothing as a result of a traumatic accident in her past. One day, new terrifying truths emerge that force her to question everyone around her.

Drama.title: Beloved
Drama.description: Catherine Deneuve & real-life daughter Chiara Mastroianni star in this beguiling tale of romance, love & lust about a mother & daughter each striving to find the one.

Drama.title: Ben Is Back
Drama.description: Holly (Julia Roberts) is swept into a race against time after her 19-year old son (Lucas Hedges) returns home for Christmas – and suddenly disappears.

Drama.title: Benjamin
Drama.description: A family calls in an intervention for Benjamin, their teenage son whom they believe to be hooked on crystal meth. Soon, it becomes clear that those who are confronting Benjamin's problem also have many problems of their own.

Drama.title: Bernie the Dolphin
Drama.description: In this heartwarming family adventure, the search for a missing dolphin leads two kids to uncover a real-estate development plan that endangers the sea life on a Florida beach.

Drama.title: Best of Enemies
Drama.description: In 1968, ideological opposites William F. Buckley Jr. and Gore Vidal hold a series of riveting, nationally televised debates that usher in a new era of public discourse and pundit TV.

Drama.title: Between Us
Drama.description: Longtime couple Henry (Ben Feldman) and Dianne (Olivia Thirlby) are afraid that if they finally tie the knot it will lead to the end of their days as free-spirited urbanites. But a whirlwind night apart, involving temptations from a duo of strangers, will either make them realize why they are together in the first place or finally drive them apart forever.

Drama.title: Beyond Paradise
Drama.description: Shahrzad, a talented music student, flees Iran and agrees to marry a man in Los Angeles. Her new life is quickly threatened by a passionate relationship with her piano teacher's gardener.

Drama.title: Birdwatchers
Drama.description: In Brazil, tensions rise when the leader of a group of Guarani Indians organizes an attempt to reclaim his tribe's ancestral territory from an unsympathetic farmer.

Drama.title: Black Cop
Drama.description: A police officer is pushed to the edge after being profiled and assaulted by his colleagues, setting him on a skewed mission of vengeance on the privileged. A satire on police, social media and racial tension

Drama.title: Blame
Drama.description: A drama teacher's taboo relationship with an unstable student strikes a nerve in her jealous classmate, sparking a vengeful chain of events within their suburban high school that draws parallels to 'The Crucible'.

Drama.title: Blind
Drama.description: A bestselling novelist (Alec Baldwin) loses his sight in a vicious car crash. Five years later, a Socialite (Demi Moore) is forced to read to the novelist as a plea bargain for her husband's insider trading. A passionate affair ensues.

Drama.title: Bolden
Drama.description: BOLDEN imagines the compelling, powerful and tragic journey of Buddy Bolden, the unsung American hero who invented Jazz.

Drama.title: Boogie Woogie
Drama.description: Modern art collectors in London scheme to acquire a valuable painting.

Drama.title: The Bookshop
Drama.description: Free-spirited widow Florence Green risks everything to open a bookshop in a conservative East Anglian coastal town. While bringing about a surprising cultural awakening through works by Ray Bradbury and Vladimir Nabokov.

Drama.title: Boomtown
Drama.description: Struggling to make ends meet, John "JT" Turner leaves his young family behind to pursue a grueling, yet highly coveted, job in a booming oil town.

Drama.title: Borg vs McEnroe
Drama.description: It's the summer of 1980, and Björn Borg is the top tennis player in the world, dominating the sport both on and off the court. A powerful and rigorously disciplined player, there is only one obstacle in his pursuit of a record-breaking fifth Wimbledon championship: the highly talented but ferociously abrasive young American John McEnroe. With three days until the tournament begins, Borg trains religiously in his lavish Monaco home, aided by his coach and mentor Lennart and girlfriend Mariana.

Drama.title: The Bounty
Drama.description: Fletcher Christian leads a mutiny against Lt. Bligh in this classic sea-faring saga.

Drama.title: BPM (Beats Per Minute)
Drama.description: Nathan is a young man who joins an AIDS activist group in 1990s Paris. As he attends the weekly meetings, he learns that some members prefer a more radical approach to their protests.

Drama.title: Brian Banks
Drama.description: An All-American football player's dreams to play in the NFL are halted when he is wrongly convicted and sent to prison. Years later, he fights to clear his name within an unjust system.

Drama.title: Brick Mansions
Drama.description: In a dystopian Detroit, An undercover cop, with the help of an ex-con, navigates a dangerous neighborhood that's surrounded by a containment wall in order to bring down a crime lord and his plot to devastate the entire city.

Drama.title: A Bridge too Far
Drama.description: Sir Richard Attenborough directs Sean Connery, Gene Hackman, Anthony Hopkins and Robert Redford in this gripping and controversial tale about a daring WWII military operation.

Drama.title: Brokedown Palace
Drama.description: Two girls who just finished high school take a trip to Thailand where they find themselves arrested for drug smuggling.

Drama.title: The Brothers McMullen
Drama.description: Three Irish-Catholic brothers deal with their respective lady troubles in Edward Burns' acclaimed indie film.

Drama.title: Bull
Drama.description: On the outskirts of Houston, a teen reeling from her mom’s incarceration and an aging bullfighter struggling to keep a foothold in the rodeo circuit, form an unlikely bond and attempt to right their own paths.

Drama.title: The Cage Fighter
Drama.description: A mixed martial arts competitor risks everything—his family, his marriage, even his life—to keep fighting in this riveting, true-life tale of resilience.

Drama.title: California Dreamin' (Nesfarsit)
Drama.description: A railway chief delays a shipment of weapons for NATO forces during the Kosovo War in 1999.

Drama.title: Call Me
Drama.description: Anna is the curious recipient of obscene phone calls that she assumes are from her boyfriend. When she arrives to meet the bizarre caller at a bar, Anna witnesses a brutal murder and becomes an unwilling player in a game of cat-and-mouse.

Drama.title: Cantinflas
Drama.description: Cantinflas is the untold story of Mexico's greatest and most beloved comedy film star of all time.

Drama.title: Captain Fantastic
Drama.description: A father raising his six kids in the Pacific Northwest is forced to leave.

Drama.title: Carrington
Drama.description: In this fact-based film, painter Dora Carrington (Emma Thompson) develops an intimate but extremely complex bond with writer Lytton Strachey (Jonathan Pryce). Though Lytton is a homosexual, he is enchanted by the mysterious Dora and they begin a lifelong friendship that has strangely romantic undertones. Eventually, Lytton and Dora decide to live together, despite the fact that the latter has fallen in love with military man Ralph Partridge (Steven Waddington), whom she plans to marry.

Drama.title: Cashback
Drama.description: Ben develops insomnia after a painful breakup. To kill time, he takes a night shift at the local supermarket. Dealing with the boredom of an eight-hour shift, Ben imagines freezing time, which allows him to see the beauty of the everyday world.

Drama.title: The Catcher Was a Spy
Drama.description: Paul Rudd stars in this true-life thriller about a Boston Red Sox catcher-turned-WWII spy tasked with assassinating a Nazi atomic scientist. With Jeff Daniels, Paul Giamatti.

Drama.title: Catching Faith
Drama.description: Alexa Taylor has a seemingly perfect life: Her daughter is an excellent student and her son is a star football player. But when things go wrong and friends turn their backs, Alexa learns that faith and family matters most.

Drama.title: Change of Plans
Drama.description: A smart and sexy comedy about a group of dinner party guests who slowly reveal hidden secrets and passionate affairs.

Drama.title: Changeland
Drama.description: Directed by and starring Seth Green, the film follows two estranged best friends on a life-changing trip to Thailand. This epic journey reminds them that there's no problem that friendship and a few rounds in a Thai boxing ring can't fix.

Drama.title: China: The Panda Adventure
Drama.description: In 1936 a widow (Maria Bello) travels to China to bring the first live giant panda to America.

Drama.title: Christine
Drama.description: CHRISTINE is the story of an aspiring newswoman caught in the midst of a personal and professional life crisis. Between unrequited love, frustration at work, a tumultuous home, and self-doubt; she begins to spiral down a dark path.

Drama.title: Christmas Belle
Drama.description: It's "Beauty and the Beast" for Christmas when auctioneer Belle goes to catalog and finalize Hunter's estate sale. Hunter begins to soften as they work together, though, putting both the estate sale and Belle's heart in jeopardy.

Drama.title: The Christmas Calendar
Drama.description: When Emily, a small town baker, receives a Christmas Calendar from a secret admirer, it attracts the attention of the locals. With financial problems looming, the calendar turns out to be a Christmas miracle for Emily and the bakery.

Drama.title: Christmas Perfection
Drama.description: A woman magically wakes up in her perfect Christmas village in Ireland.

Drama.title: A Ciambra
Drama.description: A teenage boy must grow up fast to survive life on the margins of Southern Italy in this bracing work of raw realism from executive producer Martin Scorsese.

Drama.title: The Cleanse
Drama.description: A heartbroken man attending a spiritual retreat discovers the regimen releases more than toxins.

Drama.title: Clemency
Drama.description: Years of carrying out death row executions have taken a toll on prison warden Bernadine Williams (Alfre Woodard). As she prepares to execute another inmate, Bernadine must confront the psychological and emotional demons her job creates.

Drama.title: The Client
Drama.description: A lawyer protects a boy who stands amidst a firestorm involving mobsters and the law in this adaptation of John Grisham's novel.

Drama.title: Closing Gambit: 1978 Korchnoi versus Karpov and the Kremlin
Drama.description: After Fischer beat Spassky in the 1972 World Chess Championship, the Soviets plotted to regain this coveted title by supporting Anatoly Karpov – a loyal member of the Communist Party and epitome of the young Soviet ‘New Man’.

Drama.title: The Cokeville Miracle
Drama.description: Children who were held hostage in their elementary school tell stories of miraculous things, but many adults are skeptical that the Cokeville Miracle ever truly happened.

Drama.title: The Cold Light of Day
Drama.description: Bruce Willis, Sigourney Weaver and Henry Cavill star in this pulse-pounding thriller about a man trying to save his kidnapped family.

Drama.title: Cold War
Drama.description: The Hong Kong police department has long been untouchable...until hijackers kidnap five highly trained officers and expose a mole within the task force.

Drama.title: The Color Purple
Drama.description: Celie, a Southern Black woman, gains self-respect as she strives to educate herself and to find love--despite an abusive spouse and a society biased against her race and her sex.

Drama.title: The Commune
Drama.description: From Oscar-nominated director Thomas Vinterberg (The Celebration, The Hunt), comes a funny and moving story of family and free love set in a freewheeling 1970s commune. Danish with English subtitles.

Drama.title: Cortex
Drama.description: A retired lawman (André Dussollier) who has Alzheimer's disease suspects that a serial killer is loose in his nursing home.

Drama.title: Cosmos
Drama.description: Three amateur astronomers accidentally intercept what they believe to be a signal from a distant alien civilization, but the truth they uncover is more incredible than any of them dare to believe.

Drama.title: Creed II
Drama.description: Life has become a balancing act for Adonis Creed (Michael B. Jordan). Between personal obligations and training for his next fight, he is up against the challenge of his life

Drama.title: Criminal Law
Drama.description: Attorney Ben Chase successfully defends accused killer Martin Thiel.  It is only after proving his client's innocence by discrediting eyewitness,  that Chase discovers Thiel is guilty--and intends to kill again.

Drama.title: A Crooked Somebody
Drama.description: Michael Vaughn, a phony psychic medium, is kidnapped by a guilt-ridden murderer who believes Michael can help him make peace with the spirit of his dead victim.

Drama.title: Cruise
Drama.description: Set in the 1980s, a young Italian-American from the "wrong side of the tracks" falls for a Jewish girl from Long Island.

Drama.title: Crypto
Drama.description: In this cyber-thriller starring Kurt Russell and Beau Knapp, a Wall Street banker connects a small-town art gallery to a global conspiracy, putting his own family in grave danger.

Drama.title: The Cup
Drama.description: The inspirational true story of horse racing legend who overcame incredible odds to win the 2002 Melbourne Cup Trophy.

Drama.title: The Cured
Drama.description: Humanity tries to reintegrate former zombies into society.

Drama.title: The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold
Drama.description: When Jackie, a 19 year-old Olympic-bound figure skater attempts to make a comeback from a career threatening injury, she finds an unlikely partner in a cocky, multi-talented skateboarder.

Drama.title: Daddy's Little Girls
Drama.description: Monty, a garage mechanic who lives in a poor neighborhood and struggles to make ends meet raising his three young daughters on his own. But when the courts award custody of his daughters to his corrupt, ex-wife, Monty tries to win them back.

Drama.title: Daffodils
Drama.description: A bittersweet love story told through enchanting re-imaginings of popular and iconic New Zealand songs.

Drama.title: Day Night Day Night
Drama.description: An anonymous young woman arrives in Manhattan on a bus. She receives numerous calls on her cell phone and proceeds to a hotel room. Assisted by various handlers, she prepares for her mission: to detonate a bomb in Times Square. She walks the city streets, but the time of her attack -- and thus that of her own death -- remains unknown.

Drama.title: Day of the Falcon
Drama.description: After years of bloody conflict, the leaders of two rival kingdoms (Antonio Banderas and Mark Strong) reluctantly agree to peace.  But when oil is discovered in the land, war is re-ignited.

Drama.title: De-Lovely
Drama.description: Biography of the life of composer and songwriter Cole Porter, a kid from Indiana who became a household name. The focus is how Porter, a gay man, found his inspiration from the woman he married, socialite Linda Lee Porter.

Drama.title: Death at a Funeral
Drama.description: Things go haywire when the members of a dysfunctional family gather for the funeral of one of their own in this dark comedy.

Drama.title: Deck the Halls
Drama.description: Holly (Gabrielle Carteris, Beverly Hills, 90210) returns to her hometown with her eight-year old son, Ben, to work for her father's toy business. Soon after, Ben watches a man (Steve Bacic, Big Love) move in next door with a sleigh, red suit, and lots of Christmas goodies. Ben begins to believe that their new neighbor is Santa Claus, and devises a plan to set up his mom with Santa Claus.

Drama.title: Denial
Drama.description: A historian must battle for historical truth when she is sued for libel.

Drama.title: Desperate Hours
Drama.description: An escaped convict and his two partners invade the home of an estranged Utah couple.

Drama.title: Destroyer
Drama.description: Destroyer is a gritty, riveting and complex crime thriller starring Oscar-winner Nicole Kidman in a virtuoso performance as a hardened detective worn down by the rigors of her job and the aftermath of an undercover FBI sting gone horribly wrong.

Drama.title: Detroit
Drama.description: From the Academy Award winning director of THE HURT LOCKER and ZERO DARK THIRTY, DETROIT tells the gripping story of one of the most terrifying moments during the civil unrest that rocked Detroit in the summer of '67.

Drama.title: Deuces Wild
Drama.description: In the summer of 1958 Brooklyn was in a state of unrest. Rumbles escalated into gunfights and honor quickly became a thing of the past. A new breed of wiseguys threatened to take control of Brooklyn's streets, but one gang would not back down: the Deuces.

Drama.title: Dheepan
Drama.description: Three Sri Lankan refugees (Jesuthasan Antonythasan, Kalieaswari Srinivasan, Claudine Vinasithamby) pretend to be a family as they try to make better lives for themselves in a Parisian housing project.

Drama.title: Diane
Drama.description: Mary Kay Place is extraordinary as a woman coming to terms with her troubled past in this beautiful story of redemption.

Drama.title: Digging for Fire
Drama.description: The discovery of a bone and a rusty old gun send a husband and wife on separate adventures over the course of a weekend.

Drama.title: The Dinner
Drama.description: Two estranged brothers and their wives meet at a restaurant to discuss a grotesque crime committed by their sons. With their involvement still a secret, they must decide how far they’ll go to protect the ones they love.

Drama.title: Disappearance at Clifton Hill
Drama.description: Obsessed with memories of an unsolved crime from her childhood, a young woman's investigation reveals the seedy underbelly beneath her idyllic Niagara Falls tourist town.

Drama.title: The Disappointments Room
Drama.description: A mother and her young son release unimaginable horrors from a hidden room in the attic of their rural dream home.

Drama.title: Dogman
Drama.description: Marcello is coerced into the petty criminal schemes of the local bully. When Simoncino’s abuse finally brings Marcello to a breaking point, he decides to stand up for his own dignity through an act of vengeance, with unintended consequences.

Drama.title: Don't Go
Drama.description: Between dreams and reality lies a terrifying hidden truth… A grieving father's nightmare holds the key to his daughter's death in this tantalizing psychological puzzle.

Drama.title: Downhill Racer
Drama.description: An ambitious American Skier gains a place on the team competing in Europe.

Drama.title: Drinking Buddies
Drama.description: Although they're both dating other people, two co-workers (Olivia Wilde, Jake Johnson) hang out together in bars and try to ignore their mutual attraction.

Drama.title: DriverX
Drama.description: Follow rideshare driver Leonard on a voyage through LA's late-night, temptation-filled party scene, where you never know who's going to get into your car next.

Drama.title: The Dustwalker
Drama.description: Set in an isolated town in the middle of a harsh red desert, Sergeant Joanne Sharp fights to protect the town's people as they try to survive an insidious parasite brought to earth by an Alien spacecraft.

Drama.title: The Edukators
Drama.description: Peter (Stipe Erceg) and Jan (Daniel Brühl) are "edukators," anarchists who break into wealthy people's homes -- never stealing, but serving notice to fatcats that their days are numbered. Along comes Jule (Julia Jentsch), a poor student and Peter's girlfriend, who convinces Jan to help her edukate a businessman (Burghart Klaussner) she owes money to. When Jule mistakenly leaves evidence behind, they must go back to the crime scene, where they are surprised and events quickly get out of hand.

Drama.title: El Camino Hacia El Dorado
Drama.description: Al desembarcar en las playas de El Dorado, Tulio, Miguel son confundidos con dioses y son adorados con riquezas. Deben decidir entre huir con el oro o  salvar a los pobladores de El Dorado.

Drama.title: Elena Undone
Drama.description: Fate brings two diversely different women together, and sets them on a collision course that will shatter their preconceived notions about love, life and the power of one's soul

Drama.title: Eloise's Lover
Drama.description: Asia and Eloise enter a steamy relationship that causes a scandal.

Drama.title: The End Of Violence
Drama.description: The line between life and art blur when a Hollywood producer known for violent action films is himself kidnapped by armed bandits and must find a way to escape from their bloody grasp.

Drama.title: The Escape
Drama.description: A struggling housewife sets out to reclaim her life in this stirring, emotionally rich look at what it means to become yourself. Gemma Arterton and Dominic Cooper star.

Drama.title: Escape from Alcatraz
Drama.description: Based on true events! A hardened convict engineers an elaborate plan to escape infamous Alcatraz Prison - a feat nobody had successfully accomplished before. Directed by Don Siegel (Dirty Harry).

Drama.title: The Escort
Drama.description: Desperate for a good story, a sex-addicted journalist throws himself into the world of high-class escorts when he starts following a Stanford-educated prostitute.

Drama.title: Eve's Christmas
Drama.description: On Christmas Eve, a high-powered executive's guardian angel offers her a chance to live her life again with a different spin.

Drama.title: Every Other Holiday
Drama.description: A young divorced mom takes her ex-husband home for the holidays to fulfill the one Christmas wish of her children, but finds herself caught between her protective mother and the ex she discovers she still loves.

Drama.title: Experimenter
Drama.description: Yale University, 1961. Stanley Milgram (Peter Sarsgaard) designs a psychology experiment that remains relevant to this day, in which people think they’re delivering painful electric shocks to an affable stranger (Jim Gaffigan) strapped into a chair in another room. Disregarding his pleas for mercy, the majority of subjects do not stop the experiment, administering what they think are near-fatal electric shots, simply because they’ve been told to. Milgram’s exploration of authority and conformity strikes a nerve in popular culture and the scientific community. Celebrated in some circles, he is also accused of being a deceptive, manipulative monster. His wife Sasha (Winona Ryder) anchors him through it all.

Drama.title: Eye In The Sky
Drama.description: A thriller set in the world of remotely piloted aircraft warfare.

Drama.title: Fast Color
Drama.description: Hunted by mysterious forces and a local sheriff, a young woman with supernatural abilities flees back to her family-and unearths the depths of the power within her.

Drama.title: The Father of My Children
Drama.description: Grégoire (Louis-Do de Lencquesaing) is torn between the demands of his family and his obsession with his career. He runs an independent film company and barely has time to see his frustrated wife, Sylvia (Chiara Caselli), or his three daughters during the week. Their weekends are spent trying to enjoy time together even as Grégoire compulsively checks in with his partners. After a tragic incident, Sylvia takes over the company and realizes the extent of her husband's secrets.

Drama.title: The Field Guide to Evil
Drama.description: This global anthology of eight narratives explores dark folklore through a series of myths and tales that have captivated, galvanized and frightened communities throughout history.

Drama.title: Fighting with My Family
Drama.description: Former wrestler Ricky makes a living performing with his family. When they get the chance to audition for WWE, the family's dream seems to be coming true.  However, they find out that becoming a WWE Superstar demands more than they ever imagined possible.

Drama.title: Filth and Wisdom
Drama.description: Three London flat-mates (Eugene Hutz, Holly Weston, Vicky McClure) toil at demeaning jobs while dreaming of better lives.

Drama.title: Finding Your Feet
Drama.description: On the eve of retirement, a middle-class snob discovers her husband has been having an affair, and is forced to live with her bohemian sister on an impoverished inner-city estate.

Drama.title: First Girl I Loved
Drama.description: In this Sundance award-winner, high-school misfit Anne falls in love with Sasha, the beautiful star of the softball team. When Anne tells her best friend Clifton about her new crush, his jealousy threatens more than just the girls' budding romance.

Drama.title: The Flood
Drama.description: An immigration officer must interrogate an asylum seeker to see if he's lying.

Drama.title: Flower
Drama.description: A rebellious, quick-witted teenage girl (Zoey Deutch) living with her single mom (Kathryn Hahn) conspires with her troubled stepbrother to expose a high school teacher's (Adam Scott) dark secret.

Drama.title: Footloose
Drama.description: An urban teenager who moves to a small town dominated by a fundamentalist preacher wages an ambitious war against adult repression.

Drama.title: Footloose
Drama.description: City teenager Ren MacCormack moves to a small town where rock music and dancing have been banned, and his rebellious spirit shakes up the populace. Presented by FXM.

Drama.title: Force Majeure
Drama.description: A wickedly funny psychodrama of a model Swedish family—Tomas, his wife, and their children— on a skiing holiday. An avalanche suddenly bears down on them. Tomas makes a decision that leaves him struggling to reclaim his role as family patriarch.

Drama.title: The Forgiveness of Blood
Drama.description: Two teens' lives are changed forever when a disagreement between neighbors escalates into an act of bloodshed that forces the men of their family into hiding.

Drama.title: Freak Show
Drama.description: Billy Bloom is talented, fierce and fearless but does he have what it takes to win homecoming queen? Bette Midler, Abigail Breslin star in this fabulous comedy.

Drama.title: Free Fall
Drama.description: It’s been called the German Brokeback Mountain for its portrayal of forbidden love between two police cadets as previously heterosexual Marc (Hanno Koffler) and fellow male cop Kay (Max Riemelt) embark on an unexpected life-changing affair.

Drama.title: The Furies
Drama.description: Western depicting the clash between a self-made cattle king of the Old West and his equally iron-willed daughter. Based on Niven Busch's novel.

Drama.title: Futureworld
Drama.description: Reporters discover that the director of an exclusive theme park plans to replace world leaders with sophisticated robots.

Drama.title: Gayby
Drama.description: "Gayby" is an irreverent comedy about friendship, growing older, sex, loneliness, and the family you chose.

Drama.title: Gemini
Drama.description: A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a Hollywood starlet and her tenacious personal assistant. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth and celebrity.

Drama.title: Getting Go: The Go Doc Project
Drama.description: After becoming infatuated with a hunky New York go-go dancer, college boy Doc devises a plan to get close to his crush by asking him to be the main subject in a makeshift documentary.

Drama.title: Getting Grace
Drama.description: Grace, a teenage girl dying of cancer, crashes a funeral home to find out what will happen to her after she dies, but ends up teaching awkward funeral director Bill how to celebrate life.

Drama.title: The Ghoul
Drama.description: Chris is a homicide detective called to London to investigate a strange double murder. On a hunch, and with the help of an old colleague – and former girlfriend – Chris decides to go undercover as a patient to investigate the suspect’s psychotherapist.

Drama.title: The Girl King
Drama.description: Sweden’s Queen Kristina, a flamboyant and unpredictable woman who ascended the throne at age six, was raised as a prince and strived to bring peace and education to her country—all while pursuing an illicit romance with her female royal attendant.

Drama.title: Gloria
Drama.description: Gloria is a "woman of a certain age" who gets caught up in a passionate whirlwind romance with a retired naval officer, whom she meets at a dance club for singles.

Drama.title: Gloves Off
Drama.description: A skilled fighter has to save his gym by training a gentle giant for a bare knuckle fight.

Drama.title: Golden Exits
Drama.description: An intersectional narrative of two families in Brooklyn and the unraveling of unspoken unhappiness that occurs when a young woman spending time abroad upsets the balance on both sides.

Drama.title: Good Deeds
Drama.description: For all his life, wealthy businessman Wesley Deeds (Tyler Perry) has done what's expected of him and has settled into a predictable routine. His life begins to change, however, when he meets Lindsey Wakefield (Thandie Newton), a struggling single mother who has just been evicted. Wesley offers to help Lindsey get back on her feet and, though he's already engaged, romantic sparks begin to fly. Suddenly, Wesley finds himself torn between what is expected of him and what he really wants.

Drama.title: A Good Woman
Drama.description: In 1930s Italy, a notorious seductress sets her sights on a wealthy businessman, while his new bride is pursued by a rakish playboy.

Drama.title: Goodnight Mommy
Drama.description: In this terrifying thriller, twin boys play a dangerous game of make-believe that blurs the line between nightmare and reality as they start to doubt whether their mother, recovering from cosmetic surgery, is really who she says she is.

Drama.title: The Guilty
Drama.description: When a 911 dispatcher and former cop answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman, he has to find a way to save her using just his phone and his wits in this pulse pounding, award-winning crime thriller. Danish, subtitled in English.

Drama.title: Hannie Caulder
Drama.description: A woman begins a lonely search for the bank robbers who murdered her husband.

Drama.title: The Hanoi Hilton
Drama.description: A dramatic film uncovering the horrors that endured by POWs in a Vietnamese prison camp for almost ten years.

Drama.title: Hard Night Falling
Drama.description: Goro, a criminal mastermind, plots to steal a massive cache of gold from the billionaire businessman Rossini.

Drama.title: Hateship Loveship
Drama.description: A wild teenage girl orchestrates a romance between her nanny and her father, who is a recovering addict. Stars Kristen Wiig and Guy Pearce.

Drama.title: Havana Motor Club
Drama.description: Cuban drag racers prepare for the first sanctioned race in their country since 1960. This documentary offers a fascinating glimpse at the ingenuity of the competitive spirit.

Drama.title: The Heart of Christmas
Drama.description: Megan (Candace Cameron Bure) re-examines her priorities after she sees people decorating for Christmas in October to help a family celebrate Christmas with their dying son.

Drama.title: Hearts Beat Loud
Drama.description: In Red Hook, Brooklyn, a father and daughter become an unlikely songwriting duo in the last summer before she leaves for college.

Drama.title: Heathers
Drama.description: Westerburg High School's elite clique of popular girls is "The Heathers," comprised of the powerful Heather Chandler, the green-with-envy Heather Duke, and the cowardly Heather McNamara. Rounding out the foursome is Veronica Sawyer (Winona Ryder), who is so fed up with the Heathers and the entire peer pressure cooker that she starts running with J.D. (Christian Slater), a mysterious - and possibly psychotic - motorcycle-riding newcomer. But what begins as their noble effort to rid Westerburg of its bad apples ends up taking a real toll. And their teen rebellion produces a serious and mounting body count. Shannen Doherty co-stars in this cruelly hilarious dark comedy, which became one of the biggest cult classics of the '80s.

Drama.title: Hector and the Search for Happiness
Drama.description: A psychiatrist searches the globe to find the secret of happiness.

Drama.title: Hello I Must Be Going
Drama.description: A divorcee (Melanie Lynskey) moves back in with her parents and begins a clandestine affair with a 19-year-old suitor (Christopher Abbott).

Drama.title: Henry Gamble's Birthday Party
Drama.description: Henry Gamble is turning 17 today. As Henry treads through various sexual possibilities trying to finally come into his own, so too do the adults and teenagers at the party.

Drama.title: The Hero
Drama.description: World-renowned icon Sam Elliott stars as an aging actor confronting mortality in THE HERO, a beautifully poignant celebration of life and the legacies we leave behind.  Also starring Laura Prepon, Nick Offerman, and Krysten Ritter.

Drama.title: High Strung
Drama.description: When a Midwest dancer and a street-wise British musician meet in New York, they immediately clash but there’s an undeniable attraction as well. The two must navigate their differences for a competition that will change their lives forever.

Drama.title: High-Rise
Drama.description: Tom Hiddleston stars as Dr. Robert Laing, the newest resident of a luxurious apartment in a high-tech skyscraper whose lofty location places him amongst society's upper class. Laing quickly settles in and meets the other tenants: Charlotte (Sienna Miller), a bohemian single mother; Wilder (Luke Evans), a charismatic documentarian who lives with his pregnant wife Helen (Elisabeth Moss); and Mr. Royal (Jeremy Irons), the buildings enigmatic architect. Life seems like paradise to the solitude-seeking Laing. But, as power outages become more frequent and building flaws emerge, mainly on the lower floors, social strata begins to crumble and the building descends into a class war.

Drama.title: His and Her Christmas
Drama.description: A chance meeting between rival newspaper journalists with rival Christmas columns is an epic disaster--and maybe love at first sight.

Drama.title: Hollow in the Land
Drama.description: When Alison's brother goes missing after being named the primary suspect in a trailer park murder, she must unearth the truth before her brother ends up behind bars or inside a casket. The harder she looks, the more people turn up dead.

Drama.title: Hooking Up
Drama.description: A cynical writer and a hopeless romantic hit the road for a cross-country trip.

Drama.title: Hoosiers
Drama.description: Gene Hackman stars as a basketball coach who guides a tiny Indiana high-school team to a state title in this sports classic.

Drama.title: Hounds of Love
Drama.description: When Vicki Maloney is randomly abducted from a suburban street by a disturbed couple, she realizes she must drive a wedge between them if she is to survive.

Drama.title: The House That Jack Built
